loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart is back again, requesting a small loan to stock up on inventory items. 

Sometimes, it is difficult for grocery store owners, who run small neighborhood stores in Albania, to save money for stocking up on items. Sometimes, people buy on a list, whenever they will have the money and, unfortunately, sometimes they do not pay at all. You can't force them to pay because you are aware of their financial situation.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his small grocery store in his village.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis, un campesino de 67 años de edad, se ha dedicado desde su juventud a realizar todas las labores del campo, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Luego de casarse comenzó a criar animales y a cultivar en diferentes tierras de sus familiares, donde adquirió experiencia para comenzar con su negocio propio de cultivos y ganado lechero, cuyas producciones son comercializadas en el mercado del municipio donde reside y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia, conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos. El empuje, la tenacidad y el empeño con el que realiza sus labores le han permitido salir adelante, aún cuando las dificultades económicas parecen no terminar. El cliente actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) y concentrado alimentar a sus animales, de esta forma podrá continuar con su labor y tendrá la posibilidad de sacar una cosecha más productiva y aumentar la producción de la leche, con lo que se incrementarán también los ingresos que recibe por las ventas realizadas. Luis sueña con fortalecer cada vez más su negocio y así poder garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 67, worked in agriculture since he was a youth doing all kinds of field chores, activities he learned from his parents.  After getting married he started raising animals and cultivating land belonging to various family members acquiring experience to start a business of his own growing crops and raising dairy cattle.  He sells his production in the local market in the town where he lives and generates enough income this way to support his family consisting of his wife and three children.  The drive, tenacity and effort he puts into his work have made it possible for him to get ahead even when economic difficulties seem unending.

He’s currently asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticide) and feed concentrate for his animals to continue with his work and be able to yield a more productive harvest and to increase milk production that will lead to increased income from sales too.  Luis dreams with strengthening his business more every day to ensure favorable economic stability for his family so they can enjoy better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bakhtiyot

texts.ru:
Бахтиёру 36 лет. Он женатый мужчина. Его жена работает в швейном цехе. Два сына учатся в школе, дочка еще маленькая для школы. Бахтиёр с семьей живут в городе Худжанде. На данный момент он безработный.
    В течение нескольких лет Бахтиёр жил в России и работал водителем микроавтобуса. Он возил русских горожан с одной точки города до другой. Бахтиёр не найдя работу в своем городе был вынужден на время оставить жену и детей чтобы прокормить их. Недавно он вернулся на Родину. И теперь хочет приобрести микроавтобус марки "Газель" для 16 пассажиров. Для такого закупа у Бахтиёра недостаточно средств. Поэтому он просит кредит. 
   Когда у Бахтиёра будет свой микроавтобус, он сможет работать в своем городе и ему больше не придется снова оставить свою семью. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyot is 36 years old. He is a married man. His wife works in a sewing studio. His two sons go to school, and his daughter is still small for school. Bakhtiyot lives with his family in the city of Khujand. At the moment, he is unemployed.

For several years, Bakhtiyot lived in Russia and worked as a minibus driver. He drove Russian citizens from one point in the city to another. Bakhtiyot did not find work in his own city and was compelled to leave his wife and children in order to feed them. He recently returned to his homeland. And now wants to purchase a Gazelle minibus for 16 passengers. Bakhtiyot does not have sufficient funds for such a purchase. Therefore, he is requesting a loan. 

When Bakhtiyot has his own minibus, he will be able to work in his own city and will no longer have to leave his family. He has high hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a Gazelle minibus in order to start earning a living

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is a 37-year-old married mother of four children who are 16, 14, 10 and 8 years old. She works in a fish factory in northern Albania and also has been running her own livestock activity for the past eight years. Lindita has requested this loan to buy a dairy cow and a calf.

The photo shows Lindita in front of the type of shed that every farmhouse has. Farmers store almost anything in such sheds from tools to agricultural produce that they use during winter times. 

Kindly note that our organization recently expanded to this new area where there are 23 villages that we are glad to serve.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a calf

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel tiene una edad de 51 años ella es casada y madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella 2 de ellos están cursando la carrera de educación comercial y el menor está en primaria y los 3 mayores viven en hogares aparte. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora desde hace más de 3 años ya que en compañía de su esposo practican la agricultura la cual es medio de sustento para su familia y lo ha sido por generaciones. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo cultivan es propia la cual fue adquirida por medio de una compra gracias a las ganancias en las cosechas anteriores de café las cuales han sido de gran ayuda. Gracias al cultivo de café ellos han podido saciar las necesidades de su hijos como la alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas con algunas restricciones y los estudios de sus hijos que hasta hoy en día sigue siendo medio de sustento para su familia.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con lo que podrá dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café como la limpieza, la compra de insumos para la aplicación de los mismos como el abono, fertilizantes, foliares, entre otros que hacen de sus cultivos más atractivos para sus clientes.         
Como todo productor de café ella para el futuro planea poder mejorar el rendimiento en sus cultivos de café en cuanto a producción y calidad mediante la ampliación dela misma. Su sueño es poder dar a sus hijos la calidad de educación necesaria para que ellos puedan salir adelante con sus negocios sus empresas, sus familias y todo aquel ambiente que ellos puedan fortalecer con educación y humildad.
texts.en:
Isabel, 51, is married and mother of six children three of which still depend on her.  Two of them are studying commercial education and the youngest is in primary school; the three oldest live in homes of their own.  She’s a housewife and for more than three years has been farming since she and her husband work in agriculture which has been their means of family support for generations.

The land she and her husband work is theirs; they purchased it thanks to profits from previous coffee harvests which have been of great use to them.  Thanks to coffee growing they’ve been able to meet their children’s food, dress and with some restrictions their medicine needs.  To date, it continues to be the means to pay their children’s schooling costs.

At present, she’s asking Comixmul cooperative for a loan to provide coffee crop maintenance like weeding and to buy supplies like manure, fertilizer, leaf fertilizer and others that will be applied to help make her crops more attractive to her customers.

Like all coffee growers, she plans in future to be able to improve coffee crop yields with respect to production and quality by means of expansion.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with the education necessary for them to get ahead with their businesses and their firms strengthening their families and all environments that can be so strengthened with education and humility.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to weed her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Mohzoda

texts.ru: Мохзода уже второй раз обращается за кредитом для развития торговли. Еще в начале своего бизнеса она продавала семечки потому что у нее не было денег для закупа  другого товара для перепродажи. Год за годом она начала расширяться и уже одновременно продавала хозяйственные товары. Мохзода занята в сфере торговли более 20 лет. У нее хороший опыт в этой сфере. Сейчас Мохзода готовится к зиме и хочет пополнить запасы своего товара. Мохзода собирается привести световыделяющие товары, батарейки и другие необходимые хозяйственные товары. Потому что зимой в Истаравшане электричество подают лимитом.
texts.en:
Mohzoda, for the second time, is applying for a loan for developing trade. When she started her business, she sold seeds because she did not have money to purchase other goods for resale. Year after year, she started to expand and simultaneously sold household goods. 

Mohzoda has been involved in the sphere of trade for more than 20 years. She has good experience in this area. Now, Mohzoda is preparing for the winter and wants to replenish her goods. Mohzoda intends to offer lighting products, batteries, and other necessary household goods, because in winter in Istaravshan electricity is offered in limited supply.

loans.use: to purchase household goods for developing trade

loans.name: Klodian

texts.en: The recipient of a previous loan, Klodian is back needing your help again to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell. He wants to thank every lender for helping him previously.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes and electrical kitchen ware to sell.

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a pastry/bakery shop, which she has been doing for four years, in a little town in northern Albania where the tomb of the national hero Skanderbeg is located. The town is frequented by foreign visitors all seasons who visit the museum and Antoneta’s shop is busy. There are only a few shops of this kind in the town and Antoneta's shop is almost next to the tomb and visible.

Antoneta is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy inventory items for her shop.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for her pastry/bakery shop

loans.name: Jenny Margoth

texts.es:
Doña Jenny Margoth tiene un grado de educación secundario completo por lo que al terminar sus estudio ella pudo graduarse como maestra de educación, ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales cursan la secundaria en diferentes grados de educación. Junto a su esposo al salir de sus actividades escolares se dirige hacia el campo para ejercer su segundo trabajo la agricultura que gracias al esfuerzo y la buena administración han podido sacra su negocio adelante y poder de las ganancias proveer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos dándoles la oportunidad de estudiar y de que ellos en un futuro se preparen a nivel universitario. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo trabajan es propia y agradecen a DIOS por la oportunidad de haberles brindado este logro más en su vida para generar ingresos y enriquecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Sus clientes son las bodegas, vecinos e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para la adquisición del producto al final de cada cosecha. 
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 10 QQ de formula cafetalera, 12 QQ de urea y 12 QQ de fertilizante con lo que podrá aplicar a sus cultivos y protegerlos de plagas y bichos que deterioran este producto.
Los planes a futuro son los de ampliar más sus cultivos de café por medio de la siembra, mejorando y sembrando una variedad diferente del producto como también satisfaciendo algunas necesidades en sus clientes como la demanda que actualmente maneja para dar un mejor servicio y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Jenny Margoth completed her secondary education.  When she finished her studies, she was able to graduate as a teacher.  She is married and has two children, who are in different grades in high school.  Upon leaving her school activities, she heads out to the field with her husband to exercise her second job, agriculture.  

Thanks to effort and good administration, they have been able to get their business ahead.  With the profits, they have been able to provide their children with a better quality of life.  They have given them the opportunity to go to school and to prepare for the university in the future.  

The land that she works with her husband is their own.  They are grateful to God for the opportunity of having provided another achievement in her life to generate income and enrich her children’s inheritance.

Their customers are the grocery stores, neighbors, and intermediaries that come to the area to get the product at the end of each harvest.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy 1,000 pounds of coffee formula, 1,200 pounds of urea, and 1,200 pounds of fertilizer.  She will use these on her crops and protect them from pests and insects that destroy this product.

The plans for the future are to expand her coffee crops by improving the planting and planting a variety of different products.  She will also satisfy some customer needs such as the demand that she currently manages.  She will do this in order to provide better service and to give her children a better quality of life and an education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Donero

texts.en:
Donero is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from lenders. He will purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers, rice seeds, and pesticides. He will also use part of the loan to pay for the labor cost spent in farming and snacks or food for his helpers in the farm labor. 

Donero is 46 years old, is married, and has six children. He lives in the village of Antagan with his family. According to him, its not easy to have six children, especially when they are all attending school, for a farmer like him. His wife used to budget their daily immediate needs and allowances of their children. Truly, his income in farming is not enough. He hopes that with this financial assistance, he will keep improving his rice crop production.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers, rice seeds, and pesticides, and to pay the labor costs of farming and snacks or food for his helpers in the farm labor.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKOLA   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  KOROTOUMOU (1ère à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des sacs de maïs pour ensuite les revendre au marché et en famille. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola Group are all married women with an average age of 35 years and an average of 5 children.  They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the sub-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.  

The women work with the field Partner, Soro Yiriwaso in order to run their businesses.  This will be their fifth loan with this organisation and they intend to repay it promptly.  Madame Korotoumou (on the far right of the photo) intends to buy sacks of maize with her loan.  She will then resell the maize at the market and within her family.  She expects to earn a monthly average of 9,000 francs CFA.  Madame Korotoumou will use her earnings to repay her loan and help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó tiempo atrás, cuando junto con su esposo y el dinero que él recibió de su jubilación, decidieron montar el negocio de cyber y cabinas.  Desde entonces, se han mantenido y progresado de a poco.  Trabaja todos los días, con la ayuda de su hijo, en el horario de 8 am a 10 pm.  Es casada y su esposo es jubilado de la policía nacional.  Tiene un hijo que estudia en el colegio fiscal del sector donde habitan.  Le gustaría a futuro poder ampliar su local de cyber para tener más computadoras.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos y útiles para su hijo.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Durán.  She started some time ago when, together with her husband, they decided to set up a cyber café and phone booth business with the money he received from his retirement.  Ever since then, they have maintained and progressed little by little.

She works every day with the help of her son.  Her schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She is married, and her husband is retired from the national police.  She has a son who goes to public school in the area where they live.

In the future she would like to be able to expand her cyber café in order to have more computers.  She now needs the loan to buy notebooks and supplies for her son.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and supplies for her son.

loans.name: Gjon

texts.en:
Gjon breeds milk cows and sells dairy products at the village market to earn a living. He single-handedly supports his family of six with his income. 

Gjon took out a previous loan in order to repair the stable where he keeps his cows, and this was very beneficial to his business. He feels very grateful to his lenders.

He is now seeking a new loan in order to further expand the stable. He reports, "My animals have no space to sleep well, so by expanding the stable they will have enough room to move inside and sleep well."

loans.use: To expand the existing stable.

loans.name: Betty Dionila

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Durán.  Se dedicó a la venta de comidas que ha sido un negocio familiar por mucho tiempo.  Trabaja todos los días junto con su esposo, de 5 am a 1 pm.  Es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector donde viven.  Tiene el sueño de poder terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios de buena forma.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de cuadernos y libros para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Durán.  She sells food, which has been a family business for a long time.  She works every day, together with her husband, from 5:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.  She is married and has two children who go to the public school in the area where they live.

She has the dream of being able to finish building her house and that her children complete their education successfully.

She now needs the loan to buy notebooks and books for her children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and books for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas stove, a rolling cart with shelves, a stainless steel table for packing and supplies wholesale (corn)

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is the 40-year-old mother of four children, who are attending public school.  

She wants to buy a milk cow with your help to secure dairy for her family. “It has been very difficult not being able to supply my family with dairy," Marte said, "when dairy is considered the very staple food everywhere in the rural Albania. But I had no money to buy one. So here and there I would buy from those who sold dairy.” 
 
This is her first loan.  She is a villager living in our newest area of service, the very northern Albania. These farmers up until a month ago had help from no other microfinance institutions, and they are thrilled that finally they can be served as well.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to secure wholesome dairy products for her children

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Amélie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Amélie a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Amélie est mariée à un certain Dominique. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Amélie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Amélie vend divers produits alimentaires (boîtes de conserves, pâtes alimentaires, sucre etc.) dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Amélie ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahutin Group is made up of three women who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Amélie (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  Amélie is 37 years old and attended primary school.  She is married to Dominique and they have four children.  The children all attend school and the couple are responsible for them all.  Amélie lives with her husband and their children and together they provide for the expenses of their household.

To do this, Amélie sells various food products (canned foods, pasta products,sugar, etc) locally.  In order to improve her business and meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a third loan with the other members of the Mahutin Group.  This loan has been requested from the field partner, Alidé.  Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy various food products (canned foods, pasta products, sugar, etc).

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
About a year ago Mimoza opened up a store in a village where there was no other store. She had lived in a different area before deciding to make the current place her permanent residency. 

“It has been going well from the beginning," Mimoza said. "Now I want to add more variety to the inventory, to draw more clientele. It is a good thing for me, while my husband takes care of our agricultural activity. Living on a very little income, it was not that easy; it was very stressful. Earning an income myself, it was a relief.” 

She is 29 years old and has two children, 7 and 5 years old.  The family lives in northern Albania.

loans.use: to add variety to her store's inventory

loans.name: Rustem

texts.en:
Rustem was born blind, yet still he has been running his own activity in raising livestock, and he goes to the market to sell the fresh dairy produce.  He now wants to stock up on fodder for the animals for the whole winter before the season kicks in.

“If I said that I am blind and I can’t do this and can’t do that, that would be only an excuse," Rustem said. "So, patiently I learned to do things at a very early age, and not only I worked for myself without being a burden on others, but I provided for my kids as well. I can’t say that it’s easy, though.” 
 
Rustem is married, and he has two children, who are grown-ups at the moment.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the whole winter for his animals

loans.name: La Trinité 50 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LA TRINITÉ 50" est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Agnès Aïhonsi (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Agnès Aïhonsi a très peu fréquenté l’école. Agnès Aïhonsi ne vit plus avec son mari, mais est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois à sa charge. Agnès Aïhonsi vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges grâce au revenu de son activité. Agnès Aïhonsi vend en effet du haricot et divers produits alimentaires dans sa région. Agnès Aïhonsi s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Agnès Aïhonsi ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe "LA TRINITÉ 50", sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The "La Trinité 50" ("The 50 Trinity") group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Agnès Aïhonsi (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 36 years old. She only attended a small amount of school. She no longer lives with her husband, but is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school and three of whom she currently supports.

Agnès Aïhonsi lives with her children and is able to provide for their support with the earnings from her business. She sells beans and various food products in her region, stocking up in Benin. In order to increase her business capital and to meet her customers' requests, Agnès Aïhonsi, together with the other members of La Trinité 50, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The group's previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase beans and other food products

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke, age 48, has been in the livestock industry for the past 18 years. She tells us, "Livestock is our source of income and for most people who live in rural areas and we take great care of our animals."

Pashke and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

She is requesting a loan because she would like to add another milk cow with a calf to her livestock. She is grateful for your financial help.
 
Kindly note that Pashke dressed up for the picture because it is the practice of many rural borrowers in this area to do so. Although loan officers tell them that they can be photographed simply in their daily farming clothes, many clients prefer to dress more formally.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with a calf

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en:
Tereze sells clothes in the street of a little town located in the northern Albania, since she can’t afford having her own store or renting one. Kindly note that selling in the streets is a common practice everywhere in Albania; items from books to groceries and clothes are sold this way. Even though the law has banned such practices on paper, they don’t do anything to stop it, though. 

Tereze has been a responsible client of VisionFund Albania for a very long time. A loan of ALL 150,000 is what she is requesting at the moment to help her buy items to resell. 

Tereze is the married mother of four school-aged children.  All of them have been residing in a little town the past couple of years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke has been running her own livestock activity for the past twenty years. She told the loan officer who interviewed her,  
“I love animals and everything I do for them, it gives me an enjoyment. I start my day with them and end my day with them. Petting them, it soothes me and brings a smile on my face.”

Pashke wants to repair the stable you see in the photograph. “The winters are very cold in our region and so are harsh on people and animals also. I need to make repairs before winter starts,” said Pashke.

Pashke is an widowed mother who lives in the rural northern Albania.

loans.use: to repair the damaged stable.

loans.name: Pebrita

texts.en:
Pebrita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Pebrita is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Pebrita has a buy and sell mangoes business in the Philippines. Pebrita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers. Pebrita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Pebrita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is a 37-year-old married father of two children, who are attending school and help in his carpentry business after class. He is skilled in making wood furniture like beds, chairs, tables, stools and cupboards. He is his family's sole breadwinner and he is doing both father and mother’s works at home since he lives separately from his wife due to unavoidable family circumstances. 

The process of his business starts when there is an order from his customers. He also sells made furniture from his door. He has eight years of experience in this work, which provides him with special talent and customers’ trust.

Sarin would like to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner to buy wood needed for the carpentry process. This will enable him to do his work continually as he will put much effort into improving his business productivity to attract more customers and increase his income. In the future he hopes to open his own furniture shop, where he can sell his finished products. With his humility and perseverance, he wants only to give his family economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood needed for the carpentry process.

loans.name: Eleyour Women A Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Buree-town, an outskirt of Freetown. She is married to a contractor and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending primary school.  Isatu sells cloth and dishes. She has been a businesswoman for four years now. 

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to buy bales of cloth and dozens of dishes for sale.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloth and dozens of dishes for sale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 37 years of age and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with a 6-year-old child. She runs a cosmetic sales business along with a salon. The business has been in existence for the last two years. 

Sophia knew of Milango Financial Services through friends and she decided to join so that she could save and be able to access funding for her small business. She now seeks a loan to buy cosmetic products and a dryer for her business. 

Sophia hopes the she will be owning a boutique in the next five years despite the challenges of customers not paying on time and theft. She will use the income that she will raise to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and a dryer.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi’s goals in life are having more custumers, growing her business more and saving some of her profit for the future, since she is getting older. Noemi is married, now in her fifties, and has four grown up children.  

She manages a vehicle spare parts business.  She wants a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more vehicle spare parts to maintain her customers.  She hopes that she will able to maintain the business well towards the attainment of her goals through the help of this amount of the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy more vehicle spare parts to sell to maintain her customers.

loans.name: Apayi Joice

texts.en: This borrower is planning for the Christmas season and intends to buy materials in advance before prices increase. She would like to buy more rolls of cloth and fashion designs. She was able to buy a sewing machine and more cloth. She is investing more in her business and is able to provide for the basic needs of her family including food, medical and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of cloth and fashion designs.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa, who is a vet by practice, is a 46-year-old mother of four children who are still attending public schools. They reside in rural southeastern Albania where she has been focusing her attention on livestock, agricultural activity.  Also, up until now, planting and selling beans, potatoes and onions has been her main activity, since the geographical location where she resides works in the favor of such veggies. Not only that, but the region is known for the best of such produce.
Currently she has a calf that she wants to sell, and with that money and the 50,000 Albanian Lek she is requesting from VisionFund Albania, she plans to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en:
This is Shefqet, who is being photographed with his favorite cow according to him. Not only has he been practicing his agriculture/livestock activity for the past fifteen something years, but he has also utilized his skills in beekeeping and is considered “the master beekeeper” in the region of his residence.

Shefqet is a 57-year-old married man and has two children who attend high school. He lives in rural central Albania where the roads are very bad and make it hard on farmers to come down to the market to sell what they produce, whether veggies or dairy.

Shefqet wants to buy a dairy cow now with the lenders help.

loans.use: to add one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Nanjiddash

texts.en:
Mr. Nanjiddash, 34 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on rental land. 

He has been transporting goods and products from warehouse to market site for a living. His wife just gave birth, and currently stays at home looking after their newly born child. 

He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy a land license. By securing a land license, he has the right to own and use land. The rental land he has his ger on is too costly, so he will use the loan to secure a land license. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a land license.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia tiene 60 años, está casada con Fidel quien es padre de sus 3 hijos que son ya mayores e independientes. Vive junto a su pareja en su casa hecha de adobe. Vivió toda su vida en el campo junto a sus padres y al cumplir 20 años se comprometió y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente junto a su nueva familia en un terreno de 2 hectáreas que logro adquirir con los ahorros que tenía en aquel entonces.
Uno de los principales inconvenientes  que tenía conjuntamente con su esposo fue que no contaba con dinero suficiente para usarlo como capital y comprar lo necesario para una campaña productiva tales como abonos y pago a los trabajadores para el retiro  de maleza, es por ello que trataba de solicitar pequeños préstamo a sus familiares. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de terreno exclusivamente para cultivo que ha logrado obtener como producto de su esfuerzo. No obstante debe de contar con dinero para seguir invirtiendo en sus terrenos.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que realiza para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertir en sus parcelas con la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 60 years old and is married to Fidel, the father of her three, now independent, children.  Olimpia lives with her husband in their adobe house.  Olimpia has lived all of her life in the countryside.  She grew up with her parents and, at 20 years old, she got engaged and began to work alongside her new family on a two hectare area of land.  She bought the land with the savings that she then had.

One of the biggest difficulties that Olimpia has had is that she and her husband have not had enough money to use as capital to buy necessary supplies.  They need this for their land to be productive, to buy manure, and to pay workers to remove undergrowth.  Due to this lack of money, Olimpia has tried to borrow small amounts of money from family members.  Olimpia now has three hectares of land, which she uses exclusively for crops.  She bought this land with a lot of effort.  Nevertheless, she still needs money in order to continue investing in her land.

This is Olimpia's first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  On this occasion Olimpia is applying for 1000 Nuevo Soles to invest in her land by buying organic manure for her sown fields.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un joven de 29 años, está casado con Agripina, aun no tiene hijos y vive actualmente con su esposa en su casa propia. Desde que tiene 18 años se dedica independientemente a cultivar cacao, barbasco, café y otros productos rentables de su zona con el apoyo de su esposa en un terreno de 2 hectáreas. Aprendió este oficio gracias a sus padres porque creció desde muy niño en el campo y aprendió las técnicas de cultivo necesarias para esta labor. Cuando empezó a generar sus propios ingresos por medio de esta labor no logró recuperar el dinero que invirtió debido al ataque de plagas y otros males propios del cacao, siendo motivo para empezar a trabajar con mayor motivación y un mejor deseo de superación. Para obtener una mejor calidad de sus cosechas suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta comprar un terreno para construir su propia vivienda siendo esta una de las principales necesidades. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Oscar is 29 years old and married to Agripina.  They do not have any children yet but live together in their own house.  Since he was 18, Oscar has worked independently, growing cacao, coffee, and other local, profitable products. Oscar works on his two-hectare plot of land with his wife,.  He learned this trade from his parents as, from a young age, he grew up in the country and learned the necessary techniques for this work.  When Oscar started to earn his own income in this work, he was not able to break even on the money he had invested because of a plague and other problems that affected the crops.  This gave Oscar more motivation and a greater desire to do better.  In order to have a better quality harvest, Oscar usually fertilises his land with organic manure.  One of Oscara's future plans is to build his own house - this is something he really needs.  This is Oscar's first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support her is being given in order to get ahead.  He promises to make his repayments on time.  On this occasion Oscar is applying for 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.es: Renilda tiene  28 años, está casada con Alejandro y tiene una hija con quien vive en una casa alquilada. Renilda desde muy pequeña se dedico a apoyar a sus padres en las diversas actividades agrícolas. Con el pasar de los años optó por convertir esta actividad en su principal fuente de ingreso para el crecimiento económico de su familiar al asumir su rol de madre junto a su esposo con quien labora de sol a sol en el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico. Comenta que le agrada su trabajo puesto que no está ligado a presiones y es una labor que puede desempeñar en conjunto con su familia. Al hallarse en la temporada de lluvias ha visto por conveniente adelantar el deshierbo de sus tierras por campaña para evitar que la mala hierba compita por los nutrientes de sus plantaciones de cacao, para el cual desea contar con el apoyo de personal externo para hacer más rápido el trabajo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que necesita para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta segunda oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores de la zona.
texts.en:
Renilda is 28 years old. She is married to Alejandro and has a daughter who lives with her in a home they rent. Ever since she was very young, Renilda helped her parents with different farming chores. As years went by she decided to make this business her main source of income for her family's financial growth. She took on her mother's role along with her husband, and together they work from sunrise to sunset maintaining and producing organic cacao. She says she likes her work because it is a job her family can carry out together. 

Since it is the reainy season, she decided it would be beneficial to start weeding her land sooner in order to prevent weeds from competing for nutrients with her cacao trees. She wants to do this with help from additional workers in order to get the job done more quickly. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity she needs in order to keep going. She also promises to pay her installments on time. This second time around she wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles in order to hire local workers.

loans.use: to hire local workers to work in her fields.

loans.name: Munodaani

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30 year old Munodaani from Harare. She is married with two children. One is attending school.  

Munodaani runs a retail business selling women's and men 's wear and shoes. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition and high operational costs. Munodaani has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build her own house. 

In the future, Munodaani plans to open a chain of clothes and shoes boutiques.

loans.use: to buy more women's and men's clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina earns an income by buying and selling mangoes. She has been engaged in her business for the past 11 years and works hard to support her family. She lives with her husband and children in Negros Oriental, Philippines.
  
Rizalina is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase a box of mangoes to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough money to allow her to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a box of mangoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Uheri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngalya est un leader  du groupement d’affaire « Uheri»,  doyenne,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 54 ans  et mère de 9 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers respectifs. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons.  Elle installe ses produits au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a plus de 9 ans.  La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de microprojets pour sa famille à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’accroitre son portefeuille en achetant  2 sacs de poissons salés. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. L’insécurité (due aux rebelles et autres inciviques) en cours de route d’approvisionnement (Vitshumbi-Rutshuru-Goma) est un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables, pendant ce moment critique de guerre.  Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente tiens son enfant.
texts.en:
Ngalya is the leader of this business group, Uheri.  She is a leader and an experienced entrepreneur.  Ngalya is 54 years old and mother to 9 children who are all either attending school, or living in their own households.  She is a fish saleswoman at the public market.  She started her business 9 years ago with a loan from the field partner Hekima.  With her earnings, Ngalya has already completed many microprojects for her family.  This new loan will allow her to extend her portfolio and buy 2 sacks of salted fish.  As a result of this, she hopes to be able to pay for her children's schooling and build a good house.  

The supply route (Vitshumbi-Rutshuru-Goma) for Ngalya's business is very dangerous due to the activities of rebels and other outlaws.  This is a huge challenge to the development of her business.  Ngalya would like to warmly thank Hekima for their support (through micro-credit for small entrepreneurs who cannot operate through established banking channels) at this critical moment.  It should be noted that one of the women is holding her child in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of salted fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dava

texts.en:
Dava, a hardworking lady who is in her early sixties, is requesting a loan to rebuild the stable you see in the background.

“The existing stable is not safe any more. In our region is very cold,” she said to the loan officer while giving some corn seeds to the chickens. “I feel is about time to build a new one. The winter is starting soon, and I want to have it built before that,” continued Dava.

Dava has been running her livestock activity like almost everyone in the rural area. Mostly she sells raw milk to the local market. Sometimes there is more milk produced, and she then makes cheese and sells it in a nearby city.

loans.use: To rebuild a stable.

loans.name: Erika Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Erika es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy alegre de 39 años de edad la cual curso hasta segundo grado de primaria y en compañía de su esposo trabajan en la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de café los cuales de su matrimonio procrearon 3 hijos dos están en la escuela y uno en el kínder. Ambos se dedican a la agricultura cultivo de café desde hace más de 10 años aprendió a trabajar siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar en este rubro. Su actividad y medio de ingreso económico para suplir sus necesidades y la de su familia siempre ha sido el cultivo de café por lo que diariamente se esmeran para mantener sanas sus cosechas y libres de plagas para evitar pérdidas en la misma las cuales están ubicadas a 50 metros de distancia de sus casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando. Con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio trabajando juntos como equipo enfrentando los diferentes desafíos como lo es la baja de precios en el mercado local e internacional y las fuertes lluvias (factor clima) han podido salir adelante en este rubro ya que la competencia no es factor problema. 

Sus planes a futuro y sueños como agricultora y madre es seguir cultivando y comprar más ares de terreno para que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor educación y también tengan donde trabajar. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos con un mejor nivel de vida y de las ganancias invertirá en mejorar su vivienda. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes ya que son necesarios para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café manteniendo bien asistidos sus cultivos y en esta temporada tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Thirty-nine year old Erika is very happy and very hard-working.  She completed only up to second grade at primary school.  Erika works in agriculture, alongside her husband.  They grow coffee together.  They have three children - two of whom are in school, the youngest in kindergarten.   Erika and her husabnd have been growing coffee for over ten years, having learned the trade from their parents.  Erika has always worked growing coffee in order to pay for necessities for her and her family.  Every day she goes to great lengths to keep her harvest healthy and free of plauges, so that she does not suffer any losses.  Erika's land is some 50 metres from her home, and she arrives there on foot.  With a lot of effort and sacrifice, working together as a team, facing challenges such as the low value of coffee in the local and international markets, and dealing with heavy rains, Erika and her husband have been able to prosper in their work - they have no competition in the area.

Erika's plans and dreams for the future, as a farmer and as a mother, are to keep growing crops and to buy more land so that her children can have a better education and can have somewhere to work.  Erika's dream is to see her children have a better quality of life.  She will invest her profits in improving her home.  Erika is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy fertilisers, which are necessary in order to maintain her coffee crops and to have a better yield this season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar, age 47, became the general manager of a restaurant earlier this year. Previously, he was the manager of a different restaurant. He lives alone in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Ganbataar rents out the other rooms of his apartment to students coming to Ulanbataar from the countryside. The rooms have deteriorated over the years and need significant repair. In order to make these repairs, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 MNT. He will use his loan funds to buy hardwood flooring, wallpaper, and fiberglass in order to renovate the rooms. 

After renovation, the students who rent from him will live in comfortable and warm lodgings where less energy will be wasted.

loans.use: to buy hardwood flooring, fiberglass, and wallpaper for the rooms he rents to students

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 53, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a guard. Hoa supports her family by running a laundry shop and by sewing.

She started this business ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a sewing machine and cloth to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business runs smoothly and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as snack food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living
conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of snack food and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ryla

texts.en:
Ryla is 28 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ryla has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. Ryla requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad.  Ryla has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Ryla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. Alma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is married to a retired soldier who is working now on their own farm to earn a living. For more than ten years, she helped him in order to expand and improve the farm to be able to provide for the needs of her only child. She borrowed  from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase an organic fertilizer for the farm. She planned with her husband to cultivate all the vacant lot and plant bananas for sale. She hopes to improve the general living of the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase an organic fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is requesting a new loan to upgrade the floor of her house to keep goods away from flood waters and to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to raise the floor of her house to keep goods away from flood waters and buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 56 years old and married with two children.

Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cecelia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Cecelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing gear. In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales and also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha makes and sells clothing items to earn a living. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income with which to support her family. 

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy an oversewing machine and sewing tools. She is confident that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and improving her sales. 

Ha believes that her loan funds will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an oversewing machine and sewing tools

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy materials and accessories for producing female shoes. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories for producing female shoes.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona, age 40, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and child in the Vani district.

Madona and her husband are actively involved in a family agricultural business. Specifically, they cultivate a piece of land where they grow maize, soy, and nuts. Madona sells the harvest locally and earns a seasonal income. 

She works throughout each day to generate income, but her earnings are too small to save and improve the family's standard of living. The family lives below the poverty line and receives a small amount of social assistance from the local government.

Madona would like to start up a clothing sales business in her community in order to earn an additional income. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices to start her new business. Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Madona is confident that her endeavor will meet a high demand. She intends to develop positive relationships with her customers and expects to attain a good profit from her new business. 

This start-up loan offers Madona a good chance to earn a more stable income and improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Maria Targelia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 39 años, está casada con Segundo de 38 años que se desempeña como albañil. Tienen 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 15. María vive con su familia en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. También es una ciudad ideal para actividades de comercio por el paso de turistas en la ciudad y las necesidades de sus habitantes. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
María inició con la actividad de la agricultura desde hace 20 años, siendo muy joven quiso abrirse camino en esta actividad que conoció de cerca desde muy niña, pues toda su familia siempre se ha dedicad a esta actividad. Aunque lo más difícil fue comenzar el negocio, ahora ella invierte hasta 10 horas en este negocio; desde antes del amanecer hasta que el sol se pone. María tiene varios cultivos y además cuida animales domésticos para su posterior venta como pollos, codornices, etc. Ahora ha solicitado un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de una vaca lechera con la respectiva adecuación del lugar para el potrero en el que se desarrollará, de esta forma María podrá brindar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida y además con las utilidades adicionales que se generen, podrá terminar la construcción del segundo piso de su casa, proyecto que ha estado aplazado desde hace mucho tiempo por la falta de recursos económicos. María agradece a Fundación Alternativa por invitarla a trabajar con ellos y con Kiva, pues es muy desafiante la confianza que las personas alrededor del mundo ponen en ella y sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to Segundo, who is 38 and works in construction. They have three children, who are ages eighteen, seventeen, and fifteen. María lives with her family in the canton of Salcedo, located in the western part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces on the ecuatorian mountain range. 

There are several tourist attractions in Salcedo, such as lagoons and resorts that offer extreme sports for adventurous tourists. However, this town's main business is farming, and to a lesser degree, raising livestock. It is also an ideal place for trade because of the tourist traffic and the residents' needs. In spite of these productive activities, there are very concerning illiteracy and poverty rates due to unmet basic needs, such as sewage services, which are only available in 25% of homes. 

María started farming twenty years ago. When she was very young she decided to carve a niche for herself in this business, which she had been familiar with ever since she was a small child, since her whole family were always farmers. Even though the hardest part was getting her business started, she now invests up to ten hours in this business: from before sunrise until the sun sets. María grows several crops and also raises domestic animals to later sell, like chickens, quail, etc. 

She will use the loan she is now requesting to buy a dairy cow and to adequately prepare a space for the paddock where it will be kept. This will allow María to give her children better living standards. Additionally, the extra profit that will come of this will allow her to finish building the second story of her house, a project that has been postponed for a long time due to lacking financial resources. 

María thanks Fundación Alternativa for inviting her to work with them and Kiva, because the trust that people all over the world have put in her and her dreams is very encouraging.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been working as an assistant engineer in a mining company since 2011. His wife works as a  saleswoman at a supermarket. 

Batdelger is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam and felts in order to insulate his Mongolian ger. After this insulation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials

loans.name: Gulachar

texts.en:
Gulacar is married and is 46 years old. Her family is IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city, and now live in Mahmudlu-1, a village of the Fuzuli region near a war zone.  She lives with her husband and her son. Gulacar’s daughter is married. Gulacar's husband is a vendor at the village market . Gulacar has been engaged in sheep breeding for a long time.  Her son helps her.
Gulacar has a few sheep.  She buys a lamb, raises it and sells it to earn money.  Today she needs 1300 AZN to buy new sheep for this business income.
Gulacar is thankful for Kiva, a partner of Komak organization, for the aid. In the future she wants to increase her business and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy  sheep

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a farmer  from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for over 19 years now. This is the main source of his income.

Jacinto is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm. In the future, Jacinto hopes of expanding his farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Dairiimaa

texts.en: Dairiimaa, 66 years old, lives with her son, daughter in law and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment. She has retired from work and gets state pension. Her son and daughter in law run a cafeteria and her grandson goes to high school. Her elder daughter works in Korea on employment contract. She is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass in order to renovate her apartment in preparation for incoming winter. By doing so, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved and heat loss is reduced.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass

loans.name: Undrakh

texts.en:
Mrs. Undrakh, 22 years old, lives with her husband and child in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been selling phone accessories to local people for two years. Her husband operates a billiard center. Her parents are currently looking after her one-year-old child. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy phone accessories in large quantities so that she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. She is a very hardworking woman who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories in large quantities.

loans.name: Chanagsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Chanagsuren, 34 years old, lives with his daughter in a brick house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife currently works in Korea on an employment contract, and will come to Mongolia late in December of this year. His daughter is a second grade student at an elementary school. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito De La Zona Group

texts.es:
La señora Lilian Marisela es madre soltera. De 38 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 2 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando. Se dedica a su tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio con poca mercadería  y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando mercadería tales como:azucar, arroz, fideos, golosinas, aceite, etc. En el futuro desea tener un depósito y poder distribuir a las tiendas.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a vender productos por catálogos.
texts.en:
Lilian Marisela is a single mother. She is 38 years old. She wasn't able to go to school. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She works at her general store. She started this business with little merchandise and has five years of experience. 

She is organizing a group and is requesting a loan that will be used to increase her working capital by purchasing merchandise like sugar, rice, pasta, sweets, oil, etc. In the future she wants to have a warehouse and distribute to stores. 

The other members in this group work in retail and selling products by catalog.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.   She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs. 

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business. 

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Clemente, a driver.  She is a mother of seven children. Five of her children are working and the others are still in school.  She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business.

Linda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg.   Linda earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Linda is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and to maintain her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Linda dreams of improving their quality of living and hopes that her business will flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 24 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Beverly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Beverly has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.  In the future Beverly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising chickens and rice retailing. Corazon is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wenecita

texts.en:
Wenecita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of buying and selling mangoes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell. In the future, Wenecita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Diosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

Elizabeth successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is listing Elizabeth's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries for her general store business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widowed woman, with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Dzame has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Dzame dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is a 66-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in Samtredia District with his wife and son. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and produce cheese to sell. In addition, they have a 0.3 hectare plot of agricultural land where maize is grown to sell. 

Avtandil is very hard working man and always has high quality products which is sold at a good price. He decided to open a bakery and requested a Start Up loan. The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2100 Gels and open a bakery. When the bakery is opened Avtandil will start baking Georgian bread to sell. This will increase the income for his family. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ha started a business of selling clothes 6 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 63 years old and is married with two children. She and her husband have been running a general store in front of their door for 19 years. Hoa started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, age 40, and her husband operate a store where they sell aluminum products. They have been running their business for eight years. They live with their two children in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga is requesting a loan in order to gradually expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of aluminum products to offer for sale to her customers. 

She is confident that this investment will help her business to run smoothly, and she is hopeful that it will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of aluminum products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Roc

texts.en:
Roc, 56, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running an electrical shop for nine years.

Roc is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different electrical products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business runs smoothly, and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more different electrical products to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Xa

texts.en:
Xa, 43, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 12 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a saleswoman at a local bakery shop in the town of Vanadzor, where she lives with her husband, their two daughters, and her mother-in-law. She and her husband both work to support the family. 

Marine's elder daughter (shown with her in the photo) studies at the State Pedagogical Institute of Vanadzor and is currently in her fourth year of study. Marine and her husband work hard to cover the family's basic needs, and it is very difficult for them to save enough money to provide for their daughter's education. For this reason, Marine has applied for a loan to help her pay her daughter's university tuition fees. 

The requested loan is very important for this family, and they are grateful for the support of their lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Nhang

texts.en:
Nhang is 43 years old and married. She has a daughter and a son and she lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 
She and her husband have run a general store at their house for two years. 

Nhang intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of food products to sell, such as rice, eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of food products to sell, such as rice, eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is happy that she was able to get a Kiva loan that she repaid without challenges. Her retail business improved after the loan term and now she is looking for another loan to open a new business: a grocery store that will be able to supplement her income. She hopes that in five years time she will be able to open another retail shop and a posho mill, despite the challenges of price changes and inflation and customers not paying their debts in time. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living and increase her savings.

loans.use: open a grocery store

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 45-year-old woman. She lives with her son in a small village in Kaspi district. Maia has a vineyard and produces wine to sell. In addition, the family has a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. 

Maia decided to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products. The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1200 Gels to purchase a cow.
