In order to generate more income, Durmishkhan decided to purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. He will transport passengers from his district to the capital city in return for a service fee. The local people mainly use a taxi service to connect with the capital city and Durmishkhan’s service will have high demand.  A loan of $ 3000 will help him to start his taxi business. Durmishkhan is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good education to progress in life. This loan will be a great support for the family. Durmishkhan is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Yulisa

texts.es: Yulisa de 28 años, está casada con Anatolio y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Se dedica integralmente a las actividades productivas consistentes en el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico en su localidad. Lleva casi 13 años desempeñándose de manera independiente y ha logrado hasta el momento consolidar su labor como un gran sustento para su economía familiar. Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que puede siempre contar con el apoyo de su esposo con quien viene realizando las tareas rutinarias de deshierbo, retiro de maleza, entre otros. Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la adquisición de más terrenos para dedicarlos a la producción de café orgánico y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos en beneficio de su economía familiar. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos para comprar abono orgánico y fortalecer sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yulisa, 28, is married to Anatolio and has two children living with her in her own house.  She works full-time growing organic cacao beans in her community and has been working independently for almost 13 years.  To date, she’s managed to consolidate her work as a large source of support for her family’s economy.  

She enjoys her work very much because she can always count on her husband’s support with whom she does the routine chores like weeding, clearing and others.  Her long-term goal is aimed at purchasing more land to grow organic coffee thus increasing income to benefit family economy.

This is her second Kiva loan request and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion she’s hoping for 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure to strengthen her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna, 19, is not married, has no children and lives with her parents in Tajikistan. She loves her country very much, as one can leave noise behind there and appreciate the quiet beauty of its scenery.

For the past two years Maftuna has sold food from her shop located near her house. She works around ten hours a day. She thinks her shop is doing well because she is kind and loves what she does.

Maftuna is requesting a loan of 2,500 TJS through IMON to buy more food to stock her shop. She plans to use all additional profits to improve her family’s living conditions

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her shop.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Somaly is 30 years old. She is married and resides with her parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a hair salon for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who makes an income of $5 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Somaly is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her acquire the ability to run an additional business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Elvinia Gissel

texts.es:
Elvinia Gissel es una joven de 21 años originaria de la comarca Las Mojarras una comunidad ubicada tierra adentro del municipio de El Jicaral, es soltera, estudiante de la carrera de ciencias económicas que se gana la vida laborando como maestra de primaria en el colegio de dicha localidad.
A pesar de ser joven es una muchacha bien responsable, sencilla dedicada a sus padres quienes dependen de ella.
Cursa el cuarto año de su carrera y aún con las dificultades que le toca vivir como el que tener que atravesar en una panga el inmenso río de El Tamarindo por no tener puente para poder ir a la ciudad de León a la universidad.
Se presentó por primera vez a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento, ya que se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas llamado Kiva que apoyan a las personas de escasos recursos y tal es su caso que necesita de esta mano ayuda para pagar varios meses de la universidad con el fin de no tener atraso alguno para culminar su carrera profesional y en un futuro tener un salario mejor.
Pone las esperanzas en Dios y en estas personas de buen corazón para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Elvinia Gissel, 21, is a young woman from Las Mojarras district, a community located inland from the town of El Jicaral.  She’s single and a student majoring in Economics.  She earns a living working as an elementary school teacher in said location’s school.

Despite her young age, she’s a very responsible, unassuming young woman devoted to her parents who are dependent on her.

She’s in the fourth year of her career despite the difficulties she’s had to live through to get to the university in the city of León like having to cross the immense El Tamarindo River on a small motor boat because there’s no bridge.

She came by the Ceprodel office for the first time seeking financing because she learned that there are lenders called Kiva that support people of scarce resources.  Her case is such that she needs a helping hand to pay several months’ tuition at the university so that finishing her career won’t be delayed and she can earn higher salary in future.  She’s placed her trust in God and in these good-hearted people to be able to carry out her investment.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sengly

texts.en:
Sengly is 38 years old and married. She is blessed with two children who are in school. 

To encounter the family’s hardship, she runs a small stall selling grocery items as the main source of income. To earn additional income, she plants rubber trees.  

This is Sengly's first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this new cycle, she will spend her loan portion to buy a rubber tree seedling for planting and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this purchase will support her business and provide a good income.

loans.use: to buy a rubber tree seedling for planting.

loans.name: Maqsud

texts.ru: 34-летний Максуд работает с друзьями на маленьком цехе по выпечке национальных лепешек. Он женат, отец троих детей. Максуд в течение 7 лет вместе с тремя друзьями пекут лепешки и  продают их из окошки. Таджикские лепешки являются востребованы для народа. Потому что для таджиков их лепешки являются главным достоянием народа и ценят его безгранично. Главным блюдом во всех праздничных столах являются лепешки. Максуду в его работе нравится то, что он всегда во время спасает людей от голода. Максуд просит кредит, чтобы купить дрова и муку, чтобы быть наготове к предстоящим праздникам.
texts.en: 34-year-old Maqsud works with friends in a small bakery which bakes traditional flat bread. He is married and has three children. For the last seven years, Maqsud and three of his friends have been baking flat bread and selling it from the bakery's window. Tajik flat breads are in demand. This is a staple food for the Tajiks, and people adore them. Flat bread is the main dish at every festive table. Maqsud likes that fact that his work saves people from hunger. Maqsud is asking for a loan to buy firewood and flour in preparation for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood to bake flat bread.

loans.name: Nueva Kenedy  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kennedy es un grupo integrado por 11 mujeres y 1 hombre que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para recibir estos créditos que les han ayudado mucho para mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  señora Jenny, tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 11 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un torno.
Doña Jenny  es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poderle ayudar a su esposo el cual no gana mucho en su trabajo se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos por catalogo de Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido sobretodo con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos ya que eso es lo más importante para ella.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Kennedy” communal bank consists of 11 women and one man who decided some time ago to join together to receive these loans that have helped them much to improve their quality of life.  They meet every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

One of the members of this group is Jenny, 34.  She’s married and has two children who are 13 and 11 years old.  The oldest attends secondary school and the youngest primary school.  Her husband works as a lathe operator.

Jenny is a housewife who in order to earn income of her own to help her husband who doesn’t earn much at work sells clothes, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products via catalog (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  Her method of sales is door-to-door and she works two to three hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects payments every 8 days.  She’s been doing this for five years and helps her husband especially with costs of her children’s education which is most important to her.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.   This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help the loan provide.  Her dream is that her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru: Ойше 73 года. Она проживает в районе Хуросон с мужем и тремя детьми. Ойша самая опытная и самая физически активная пожилая женщина в своем селе. Ойша занимается животноводством, выращивает крупнорогатый скот у себя во дворе. Она в этом бизнесе более 35 лет. В такой нелегкой работе ей помогает сын, но за всем она следит сама. Ойша берет кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов крупного рогатого скота с целью увеличения поголовья скота и дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Ойша надеется, что это принесет ей доход, и она сможет еще больше развивать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Oyshe is 73 years old. She lives in Khuroson with her husband and three children. Oysha is the most experienced and the most physically active elderly woman in her village. Oysha works in animal husbandry raising cattle in her yard. She has been in this business for over 35 years. Her son helps her do this hard work, but she keeps a watchful eye on all of it. Oysha is taking out a loan to buy a few head of cattle in order to increase the number of livestock she has and further develop her business. Oysha hopes it will bring her income, and she will be able to further develop her business.

loans.use: buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.ru:
Мухидин около 7 лет работает водителем экспресс маршрутки или микроавтобуса для 7 пассажиров. Маршрут Мухидина называется Т-67. Мухидин 42-летний женатый человек, имеет четверых детей. Его жена дома занимается шитьем женских платьев. Дети двое учатся в школе, а двое еще маленькие. 
Мухидин берет кредит, чтобы отремонтировать и декорировать свой микроавтобус. Таким путем он добивается внимания пассажиров и привлечения их. Мухидин часть денег потратит на салон машины, чтобы его клиентам было удобно ездить. Таких водителей микроавтобусов, которые думают об удобстве своих пассажиров очень мало. Надеемся таких как Мухиддин заботливых водителей будет по городу больше.
texts.en:
For about seven years, Muhidin has been driving a seven-person van on a bus route. Muhidin's route is called T-67. Muhidin is a 42-year-old married man with four children. His wife works from home sewing women's dresses. Two of the children are in school, and two are still small. 

Muhidin is taking out a loan to repair and renovate his vehicle. This way, he will attract passengers and get their attention. Muhidin will spend some of the money renovating the interior of the car so it will be comfortable for his customers. Very few minibus drivers think about the convenience of their passengers. It is to be hoped that the city will have caring drivers like Muhidin.

loans.use: repair his van so that customers will have a comfortable ride.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 41-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with 4 children, ages 21,19,12 and 4 year old respectively. She engages in farming. She grows and sells beans to help augment the income of her household. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds (beans) and a sprayer.

In the future, Lucita would like to expand her farming business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds (beans) and a sprayer.

loans.name: Flor Daisy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 63 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos  mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa. El esposo es chofer. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad hace muchos años atrás.
Doña Flor tiene un pequeño taller de costura y bazar en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, ella trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller para que les confeccione sus prendas, además de trabajar bajo pedido ella también elabora vestidos de niñas las misma que las pone en sus vitrinas y las vende cuando alguien los necesite, ella vende sus productos de bazar y confecciona sus prendas a la mismo tiempo. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y le va muy bien. Con esto ella ayudo y sigue ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar telas, materiales para la costura y artículos de bazar. Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Parque a la Madre” (To the Mother Park) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the extensive plantations of uniquely flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Flor, 63, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three adult children.  The youngest of them still lives at home.  Her husband’s a driver.  She learned dressmaking and design at a local academy many years ago.

Flor has a small sewing workshop and general store at home.  She makes all types of clothes there and works to order for individuals who come to her workshop to have their clothes made.  In addition to working to order, she also makes clothes for girls that she puts in her display cases and sells when someone needs them.  She sells her store goods and her clothes at the same time.  She’s been in business 12 years and does very well.  She’s helped her family to get ahead this way and is still helping them.

This loan is to buy fabric, sewing supplies and store goods.  She’s been in the communal bank almost from the beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to continue moving forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing supplies and store stock merchandise.

loans.name: Kelly Deysi

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y para poder tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia, sobre todo porque tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad; Kelly  trabaja en un wawawasi, el cual en una especie de guardería, en la cual cuida a niños de 1 mes hasta 3 años aproximadamente, Kelly trabaja alrededor de 9 horas, y ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucho cariño por los niños y sobre todo tiene paciencia.

Kelly esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y poder luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Estudiar una carrera profesional y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Kelly, 24, lives in the city of Imperial and in order to earn her own money to be able to cover family expenses, above all because she has a two-year-old son, Kelly works in a ‘wawawasi’, which is a type of child care center where she cares for children from one month to three years of age approximately.  Kelly works about nine hours daily and believes she does well in her work because she has much affection for the children and above all is very patient.

She’s grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided she will be able to buy building materials to do some home improvements and be able to improve her quality of life and strive to make her dream reality: to study a professional career and provide her son with a profession.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann, age 34 and a married mother blessed with five children, is a farmer who grows rice and cassava as the primary source of income. To help her in earning additional income, her husband catches fishes for resale and works for others for a fee. Ann has been involved in the current business for 10 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day.

Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a cycle, Ann has managed to utilized her past loan wisely to improve her living condition better than before, and has repaid her past loan already.

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs.

She hopes that she can gain a good income from her cash-crops.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Originally from Kandal province, Sophorn is 42 years old and a mother of seven children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on two hectares of land which she has occupied for 10 years. Sophorn is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s field partner). She is seeking for her first loan as an education loan in order to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree specializing in English Literature. She does believe that this financial support will help her son in time so her son can focus on his studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Julieta has been in the business for more than 30 years now.

Julieta is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, candies, cooking seasonings and other items. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Julieta has hopes of making her business a success, as well as a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, candies, cooking seasonings and other items

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia es una joven de 36 años, madre soltera de dos niñas una de ellas en edad escolar, habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su infancia y juventud.
Se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria en la escuela de la comunidad La Palma a unos 5 kilómetros de dicho poblado donde le toca viajar en bicicleta diario para estar puntual en su centro de estudios.
Con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y tener un mejor salario está estudiando el último año de la licenciatura en Ciencias de la educación donde le toca viajar todos los sábados a la ciudad de León a la universidad.
Debido a que su salario es bajo y solo alcanza para sobrevivir está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con fondos Kiva para tramitar su título universitario ya que para finales de este año ya debe estar pagado.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión y ser una profesional titulada que esta beneficiará a su familia.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is 36 years old, and has lived all her life in El Sauce municipality.  Karla is a mother to two girls, one of whom is of school age.

Karla works as a secondary school teacher at the La Palma community's school, some five kilometres from her home.  She cycles to work every day in order to arrive on time.

With the aim of improving her quality of life and earning a better salary, Karla is studying the final year of a degree in education.  For these studies she must travel to the university in the city of León every Saturday.

Because she earns a low salary and has only enough to survive, Karla is applying for a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva in order to pay for her degree title - she needs to pay this fee by the end of the year.

Karla hopes and trust in God that good-hearted people will support her application and help her with a loan so that she can become a degree-qualified professional - this will benefit Karla's family.

loans.use: to pay for her degree title.

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
Thim is 47 years old and a mother of three children who are in school. She earns a living via rice farming and grocery selling business. She has been involved in current business for 17 years. This is not a first-time loan for Thim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has smartly used her past loan to improve her living condition better than before, and she has fully paid back her past loan completely.

Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for weeding fees and buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can gain a good income, better than before, to better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a tea farmer in kayembe-Kibingo Kyamuhunga in Bushenyi District. He started farming in 2000 for self sustenance reasons. He works on the tea farm two days a week, and dedicates six hours per day. He started farming in 2000 and has not looked back since then. He says farming has helped him earn income, which he has used to cater for the needs of the family.

In addition to farming, he has a retail shop which boosts the income of the family. His major client is Ankole Tea Estate, which buys off a big portion of the tea he harvests. He would like to use the money (800,000 UGX) to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soils so he can have better harvests.

He has high hopes of getting personal progress, especially if the loan is given and injected into the business since this will result in profits. Elias describes himself as a hardworking man who promises to stay as the hardworking man he has always been.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is 50 years old and married. She is blessed with three children, one of whom is still in school. For her family, three hectares of paddy rice farming is the core income generating activity, which she has been involved in for 20 years.

This is not the first loan for Khoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has enabled her to improve her living condition better than before and  keep her kid in school. 

For this cycle, she applied for a new loan to pay for her daughter’s school fees. She hopes that her daughter can fulfill her dream of holding a bachelor's degree majoring in Accounting, and get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 46 years old and married. He and his wife don’t have any babies yet, but they hope to have one soon. Mao has been working in the construction field for nearly five years. He, along with his team, go around Kampong Thom province to perform constructions according to orders from the clients. He got involved in this type of business at a very young age. The challenge he meets in his business is that he doesn't have a motorcycle for commuting to far-distance areas, which is an expense he wants to eliminate.

In this regard, he has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, to buy a used motorcycle to facilitate his travelling. This will enable him to go to work on time and without needing to pay for a daily taxi service. 

In the future, he plans to own a building team as his part-timers to perform the construction, and make his business a more viable source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to facilitate his travelling.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is kind and hard-working. She is 38 years old and married, with three children. 

She is a businesswoman. Sabohat began her business by selling national shawls. She sells her goods in a local market. Sabokhon has been busy with this business for more than 11 years. Sabohat manages the business alone as her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Sabohat, little by little with passing time, has developed her business. She hopes to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 to buy more shawls. She awaits your support. 

From the profit she is going to improve her general living conditions. She has always wanted to help orphans because she is kind. If she can maximize her profit, she would help them.

loans.use: To buy more shawls to sell

loans.name: Pheak

texts.en:
Pheak is 23 years old. She is single and resides with her mother in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her mother sells all kinds of drinks and gasoline. She earns about $3 each day.

Due to lack of funds, Pheak is requesting a loan of $800 to pay for her mother’s illness treatment. This money will help her mother recover from her sickness.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's illness treatment.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
A local resident from the Kandal Stoeung district of the Kandal province, Mon is a 40-year-old mother of four children who are still in school. To strive for a living, she does rice farming and is a paid worker at the garment factory as her main sources of income. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

Having never borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Mon is applying for an education loan to cover her son's tuition fee. He wants to hold a bachelor degree with a major in electronics. She hopes that her son can learn a technical skill and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative is Emelia (on the left in the photo), who is 56 years old. Emelia did not go to school. She is a widow, with two children, both in school. 

Emelia is financially responsible for her children, who live with her. Emelia pays for all the expenses of their household. 

This is why she has been selling smoked fish from her home for 10 years now. She has asked for a loan to buy two cartons of fish at a cold store in Ghana. 

In order to strengthen her business, Emelia joined the other member of her group in requesting this seventh loan of GHS 1,600 from the field partner ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with 10 children. The youngest is seven years old. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. 

Dionesia engages in farming. She grows green onions to help augment the income of their household. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer, to gain a greater harvest.

In the future, Dionesia hopes to expand her farming business and increase her business' profitability for the benefit of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Chamruen

texts.en:
Chamruen is 31 years old. She is married and resides with a four-year-old child in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a rice mill; he makes an income of $6 daily.

To improve her family’s finance, Chamruen is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to breed then resell when they gain weight. This purchase will help her earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to stop working at the factory, run her own tailoring shop at home, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed then resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Lilia Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Lilia, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Lilia para salir adelante junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, vende todo tipo de productos desde víveres, carnes, legumbres,  además de artículos de bazar y papelería, allí junto  a su esposo  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Su negocio es muy concurrido  por la atención que se les da a los clientes y porque ellos encuentran de todo en su local, es por eso que sus clientes los  prefieren.  Tienen más de 30 años con su negocio y  es como siempre han salido adelante y han formado a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The "Parque A La Madre" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, which is known as the 'Sultana of Coffee' for its extensive cultivation of coffee with an incomparable flavor, for its cuisine and for the quality of its people. 

This is where Lilia lives. Lilia is 63 years old, is married and has four adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives in her house. Her husband is a merchant. To get ahead, Lilia and her husband have a store in their house. They sell all kinds of products, from foodstuffs, meats, vegetables and also cookware and stationery. She and her husband work every day from 6 am until 8 pm and they have everything at their store; that is why their customers prefer them. They have had this business for more than thirty years and it's like it always was. They have gotten ahead and raised their children.

Lilia is going to use this loan to buy foodstuffs to further stock her store. She has been part of the communal bank for seven years, and she likes it because the loans help her to get ahead. Her dream is to keep improving each day.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Peregirino

texts.en:
Peregirino is a 44-year-old married man and father of six children. He is a business man who has a retail shop in Kiyanga Bumbaire – Bushenyi and does some brewing in the same area. He started the shop in 1993, and has seen the business grow slowly but steadily. He began the business so he can be in position to get money to support his family.

He would like to use the 1,200,000 UGX loan to re-stock the business so he can supply his customers with the needed items and be in position to compete favorably with the other traders in the same area.

His customers (for the retail shop business) are people from around his area, and the clients for the brewing business are mainly bar owners in rural Bushenyi.

His future hopes include seeing all his children educated and having all the basic needs of life. He describes himself as an honest man, which has helped him a lot in the business.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Changamwe near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 26 years old and married with two children. she has been in the food industry for the last three years and her business has been growing. A major challenge she faces in the business is transportation, and she now wants to buy a motorbike and venture into this business. 

She knew Milango through friends who invited her, and she decided to join so that she can save and be able to access credit for her business. Now she seeks a loan to buy a motorbike. She will use the income that she will raise to take her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran wants to thank all of the lenders who helped him with his service business of cleaning and washing buildings and homes. The loan he previously requested was used for repairing his vehicle, necessary for work-related transportation. His business is going well, and he is satisfied with the income he generates, as well as being very happy and satisfied with the previous loan. 

Now, he needs a second loan for the same business but this time to buy a new machine for deep-cleaning carpets. With this loan he will be able to improve and complete work as demand for his services increases. 

His goal is to further expand his business in the future and increase the number of employees he has. 

Goran is very happy for this second support and wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To buy a new machine for deep-cleaning carpets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en:
The national Tajik women's dresses sewed by Gulsanam are wonderful.  She is 28 years old and divorced, with one child. Her husband remarried, and he doesn’t help Gulsanam to provide for their child. 

Gulsanam tries to provide her child with a better quality of life.  That’s why four years ago she began her own business, sewing the national dresses for women. She works from her house. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. 

Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. Now she wants to repair her house, as her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 to buy building materials. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo Antonio Mayor de edad acompañado, originario del municipio de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, es propietario de una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación en la que ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, productos congelados, ropa, chineria, sandalias, al igual que los fines de semanas realiza deliciosas sopas de gallinas con albóndigas, de res con punches y mondongo, sus compras las realiza en mercados del municipio al igual que a camiones distribuidores, Gerardo tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da poco al crédito los cuales recupera semanal o quincenal, el inicia su negocio desde muy joven buscando un mejor nivel de vida para ayudar con los gastos de su familia,  uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio y su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo y perecederos para realizar sus deliciosas y sabrosisimas sopas.
texts.en:
Gerardo Antonio is an adult, is in a committed relationship, and is from the city of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. He is the owner of a small grocery store located in his house, where he offers products for home consumption such as basic grains, candy, detergents, frozen products, clothing, chinoiserie and sandals. On weekends he also makes delicious soups, like chicken with meatballs, beef with crabs and tripe stew. He makes his purchases at markets in the city and from distributor trucks.

Gerardo has both established and new customers to whom he sells a small amount on credit, which customers repay weekly or biweekly. He started his business at a very young age, seeking a better standard of living to help with his family's expenses.  One of his dreams is to be able to improve his business and his home.

The objective of this loan is to obtain working capital in the purchase of products for consumption as well as perishable products to make his delicious and scrumptious soups.

loans.use: to buy products for home consumption, clothing, shoes and perishable products

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren is 45 years old and the widowed mother of five children. She lives in her own home with her four unmarried children in the Baray district, while her oldest child lives separately with his new family. 

Saren, being a responsible mother, works very hard to provide enough for them. She is dedicated to farming, and she also runs a general store selling different kinds of merchandise from her home.

With the amount requested, she aims to pay for the vocational training fees of her son, who is currently studying in Phnom Penh. She will also use the remaining balance to buy additional merchandise to sell in her general store.  

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay the vocational training fees of her son

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder obtener ingresos para salir adelante trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su labor alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; Jorge cree que esta saliendo adelante por su responsabilidad.

Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo con lo cual podrá conducir un vehículo en buen estado y evitar accidentes, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de mecánica”
texts.en:
Jorge is a 35-year-old young man. He lives in the city of Imperial, and to earn an income in order to get ahead he works as a mototaxi driver. He dedicates himself to his work for about nine hours a day, and he can attend to up to fifteen customers each day. Jorge thinks that he is getting ahead because he is responsible.

Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him he will be able to do general maintenance on his vehicle. He will thus be able to drive a vehicle in good condition and avoid accidents. In this way he will be able to improve his earnings and keep striving to make his great dream a reality: "To study for a career as a mechanic."

loans.use: to do general vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Elvira en su venta de productos de tocador, lo cual hace mediante guías especializadas o catálogos. Ella se benefició porque aumentó con su crédito su capacidad de compra y mejorar sus ganancias, pues compra de contado. Elvira dice a sus financiadores: Gracias  Kiva por el apoyo,  y también por creer en ella. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de tocador, sabanas toallas,  colonias y perfumes, que vienen en su catalogo, en las líneas femeninas y masculinas. Ella con esta inversión responderá a su clientela que le ha solicitado pedidos y con ello incrmentará su volumen de ofertas.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Elvira sell her toiletries, which she does through specialized guides or catalogs.  She benefited because her loan increased her buying capability and improved her profits, as she buys in cash.  Elvira says thank you to Kiva's lenders for their support and for believing in her.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan she will use to buy toiletries, sheets, towels, colognes, and perfumes from her catalogs, from the men's and women's lines.  This investment will allow her to fill orders for a customer and increase the amount of products she has to offer.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, sheets, towels, colognes, and perfumes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a business selling Leso (women wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase 20 pieces of Leso’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of Lesos (women wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Afërdita

texts.en:
Aferdita is married and the mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 16 years old, all living in an Ashkali community. Two of the children are currently attending school, while she stays home and takes care of the other children and the home. Her husband works transporting goods for others when needed, but makes a low income. 

They used to live in a very old house in poor condition, but have now finally managed to build a new one, although it still needs work on the outside, such as painting and a facade. Aferdita is asking for a loan in order to complete the home so that they will have a better place to live.

In the future she hopes to find a job and provide more income for her family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To complete her home so her family will have a better place to live

loans.name: Maritza Yaneth

texts.es:
Maritza de 41 años, tiene un nivel de estudio de primer grado, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, su hija quien está estudiando, además vive con tres sobrinos que ella los está cuidando, dos están estudiando, una estudia bachillerato y el otro está en educación básica.   

Ella realiza ventas de panes con pollo, enchiladas, enredos refrescos, etc.  los domingos para salir a vender al campo, donde juegan y llega mucha gente, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia desarrollando la actividad.

El crédito lo necesita para invertirle a la venta, comprara más insumos para elaborar más antojitos;  para tener un poco más de ganancias, y una parte para cambiarle techo a una habitación. 

Desea, seguir trabajando para mejorar su vivienda y darle lo necesario a su hija y sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
Martiza is 41 years old.  She has a first-grade education.  She lives with her husband, who works as a carpenter, her daughter, who is in school, and she also lives with three nephews she is looking after, two of whom are in school, one in high school and the other in grammar school. 

She sells bread with chicken, enchiladas, sodas, etc. on Sundays out in the field where they play games and lot of people hang out.  She has had her business for five years. 

She needs her loan to invest in sales; she will buy more ingredients to make more snacks.  This will provide her with a little more income and part of it will go toward re-roofing a room.  

She wants to keep working to improve her home and give her daughter and nephews what they need.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more snacks; to make more profits; and in part to re-roof a room

loans.name: Hilda Marina

texts.es:
Salcedo, ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. Una ciudad ideal para actividades de comercio por el paso de turistas en la ciudad y las necesidades de sus habitantes. A pesar de estas actividades productivas que se desarrollan como la agricultura y ganadería, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares pero en lo cual las autoridades locales se encuentran trabajando para resolver este tipo de necesidades en cada hogar.
En esta ciudad de gente emprendedora vive Hilda una mujer soltera de 36 años que tiene 2 hijos a quienes ha sacado adelante sola y que además son quienes ahora le ayudan en su trabajo de crianza de cuyes para la posterior venta. El cuy es un animal que en el Ecuador se vende tanto para mascotas como para prepararlo asado en diferentes lugares del país y lo sirven acompañado de papas con salsa de maní. Es así que Hilda lleva comercializando estos animalitos desde hace 10 años e invierte al menos 4 horas cada uno de los 7 días de la semana, para así entregar a sus clientes los animales bien cuidados y robustos con lo que logra fidelidad de sus clientes y además la recomendación de nuevas personas que demanden de estos animales. 
Hilda requiere un crédito que lo utilizará para mejorar la estructura de los criaderos de sus animales y además para comprar alimento que aporte una mejor nutrición a los mismos; con las utilidades que genere Hilda podrá ahorrar para comprar el terreno que sueña para desarrollar más la actividad agrícola. Por esta razón agradece a Fundación Alternativa por darle la oportunidad de que a través de Kiva pueda conseguir el financiamiento necesario para dar los primeros pasos de la obtención de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Salcedo, located in the eastern part of Cotopaxi, is one of the most important provinces in the highlands of Ecuador.  It is an ideal city for commerce because of tourist traffic and the needs of its inhabitants.  Despite the productive businesses of farming and ranching, there are worrying levels of illiteracy and poverty.  Many basic services, like for example sewage systems, are only in 25% of homes, but the local authorities are working to resolve these issues in every home. 

In this city of enterprising people lives Hilda, a single, 36-year-old woman with two children whom she has cared for alone and who now help her with her work raising guinea pigs for sale.  The guinea pig is an animal that is sold in Ecuador as both a pet and as food in different parts of the country, where it is served with potatoes and peanut sauce.  Hilda has been selling these animals for 10 years and she spends at least four hours a day, seven days a week with them to deliver her customers well-cared-for, strong animals.  This earns her customers' trust and their recommendations to new people who are looking for these animals.  

Hilda needs a loan to improve the animals' nurseries and to buy feed that is more nutritious for them.  With the earnings Hilda generates, she will be able to save up to buy the land she has dreamed of so she can farm more.  She thanks Fundación Alternativa for giving her this opportunity through Kiva to get the financing she needs to take the first steps toward achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to improve her guinea pigs' nurseries

loans.name: Azuberi

texts.en:
Azuberi appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES.10,000 to purchase more bales of  clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of  clothes for resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariama, from Torpoittown in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 8 years and 13 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Mariama established her salon business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business 8 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.  
,
Mariama requires a loan to purchase more hair, hair-relaxing cream, and curing pins to expand her business . She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more hair, hair-relaxing cream, and curing pins to expand her salon

loans.name: Luvy Zulema

texts.es: Luvy, tiene 40 años de edad,  es casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella lleva 13 años de dedicarse al comercio. Vende ropa de segunda para damas, caballeros y niños como pantalones jeans, camisetas, short, camisas, blusas, faldas y ropa de niño de manera ambulante y en su casa. También vende topogigios (helados)en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar ropa usada mixta para aumentar inventario y vender. Su plan es trabajar para que sus hijos puedan tener educación y vivienda.
texts.en:
Luvy is 40 years old, she is married, and she has two children.  She lives with her family in Choloma, Cortes.  She has been working in her business for 13 years.  She sells second-hand clothing for women, men, and children.  She sells pants, jeans, t-shirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, skirts, and children's clothing.  She sells the clothing by foot and from her home.  She also sells ice cream from her home. 

She is seeking a loan for 10,000 lempiras so that she can buy used clothing to increase her inventory and sales.  Her plan is to work hard so that her children can have a good education and a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rolito

texts.en:
Rolito is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Rolito is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and farm. 

In the future, Rolito hopes of making his business a success and saving money for the school expenses of his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Carmen Candelaria

texts.es: Carmen de 33 años de edad es una mujer  muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella  trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y cultiva sandia; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Carmen solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. así como muestra la fotografía para seguir con su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old and she is a hard-working and friendly woman.  She lives with her husband and their 3 children.  She works very hard on her own plot of land where she plants and grows corn and watermelon.  Her produce is of very high quality and is sold in various markets that are near her home.  

Carmen is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, compost, etc.  As shown in the photo, she needs supplies in order to continue with planting, as she is eager to increase her sales and thus her income because she wants to provide her family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, compost, etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 61 years old, married, from the Khoni District, West Georgia. He lives with his spouse and two school age children. The only source of income for the family is a small monthly salary (nearly $90) earned by Omar who works at the local municipality. He has a small nut garden and sells nuts seasonally. The income from his harvest is modest and insignificant.

 Now, Omar is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and start a poultry farm. He will keep them in a hen-coop located in his yard and raise them. After several months Omar will sell the chickens for a good price and invest the funds in the next cycle. The family will have an additional source of income from poultry farming and they will be able to increase their daily spending for necessities. Omar hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a poultry farm

loans.name: Salomey's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, who all live in the same neighborhood. 

The group representative is Margaret (in the middle of the photo), who is 27 years old. Margaret is an elementary school leaver. She is married and has two children, both in school. Margaret and Stephen, her husband, are financially responsible for her children, and they all live together. Margaret and Stephen pay all the expenses of their household. 

This is why Margaret has been selling wax-prints from door to door for two years now. She buys her wax-prints from the central market in Ghana. 

To strengthen her business, Margaret has joined with the other members of her group to request this fifth loan of GHS 1,600 from the field partner ID-Ghana .

loans.use: To buy more wax-prints to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from the loan assisted their everyday expenses at home. She has this business for eight years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 35,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda dreams to be more successful and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week, and it is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal. María tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: María is 58 years old and lives with her partner and their son.  María has a tortilla stand that is well-known in her local area.  She has many clients as she sells the best tortillas - the service is fast, and the tortillas are warm and sold at affordable prices.  María is enterprising and has a desire to get ahead.  She has a winning attitude and so always stays ahead of the competition.  María believes that, when somebody wants something, they must know how to take risks and that this is what makes life worth the trouble.  María wants to take this risk in order to expand her business.  So, she has applied for a loan from Integral - this will allow her to buy corn in bulk, as well as lime.  María hopes that with this loan she can bring her home financial security and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk, as well as lime.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town Bo. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 18 and 23. Her children are currently attending school. 

Kadiatu runs a food stand; she sells rice, pepper, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week and works ten hours per day. Kadiatu says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take care of her family.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasonings, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 34 años,  logro estudiar ,hasta 1° año de bachillerato, su padre   lo abandono cuando tenia 4 años y creció con un padrastro,  debido a la pobreza decidió dejar de estudiar para  ayudar a que sus otros 2 hermanos pudieren estudiar. él esta casado y tiene dos hijos.

Él  se dedica  a la agricultura desde que tiene 12 años,  fue con su mamá, y su padrastro que a prendió el trabajo, además de la agricultura se dedica a la albañilería; eso lo aprendió con un amigo que le dio trabajo de batidor de mezcla, pero al ver la inteligencia de él, le dio oportunidad de pegar ladrillo,y nos comento que esta muy agradecido con Dios y ese amigo, que le enseño el trabajo de albañil. Se levanta  4:30 a.m, , para llegar temprano al trabajo pues le toca que caminar, unos 40 minutos, para llegar al trabajo. 

El préstamo sera utilizado, en la compra de  una novilla, pues siempre a deseado tener una vaca.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria, además, sueña con tener unas cuatro vacas que den leche, y así tener el sustento para su familia y pagarle el préstamo lo más puntual posible a la Institución.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old and attended his first year of university, but due to his family's poverty, he decided to drop out so that he could help is two brothers attend school.  His father left him when he was four years old and he was raised by his step-father.  Now he is married and has two children.

He has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  His mother and step-father taught him this work.  Besides agriculture, he also works in masonry.  He was taught by a friend that later gave him work as a mixer, but because his friend saw that he was very smart, he gave him the opportunity to do the stonework.  He tells us that he is very thankful to God and to his friend that he was able to become a mason.  He gets up at 4:30 AM so that he can arrive early to work, since he has to walk 40 minutes to get there.

This loan will be used in the purchase of a heifer (female cow) because he has always wanted to have a cow.

His dream is that his children will attend university and that one day he will have 4 cows that provide milk, as this will help sustain his family.  He promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer (female cow).

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan is a 64-year-old man and lives with his common-law wife and four children in a small village in the Bakan district, Pursat province. He is involved in a farming business, growing rice and other seasonal crops on one and half hectares of farmland. He has two cows helping him with the maintenance of the rice fields.

Chhan would like to have a latrine in his house but due to inadequate capital, he has applied for a loan of  2,000,000 KHR (Cambodia riels) from Kiva partner HKL to build a latrine and buy its accessories. By having a latrine for the household, he is able to keep his family's environment clean, protect them from spreading diseases, and increase their personal hygiene. He is very happy and thankful, because with this loan, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate, better than its general loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años siembra maíz, adicional a eso vende mariscos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas y las ganancias de la venta de mariscos  logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa en casa propia. El cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su esposa.
texts.en: This borrower has been working in agriculture for three years.  He grows corn and, in addition, sells seafood.  With the sales from his harvest and the profits from selling seafood, this investor is able to cover household costs.  He is responsible, honest and hard-working.  The borrower lives with his wife in their own house.  The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies, such as fertiliser, manure, and seeds, for the harvest.  Some of the products he will buy can be seen in the photo.  The borrower does not earn enough to cover the costs of buying these supplies.  With this loan the borrower will have a better income and more financial stability for him and his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Mariatu, from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is single with two children, ages 6 years and 11 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Marie established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to create a permanent source of income. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.  

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Celia dreams that her business will grow and expand and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Dankani

texts.en:
Dunkani is 27 years old and the father of one. 

He has a retail shop that he started in 2011 with a purpose of earning money from the shop to cater to the needs of his family. He works seven days in the week, and he dedicates eight hours to the retail business per day. The business is located in Ishaka town-Bushenyi District along one of the busy streets in town. In addition to the shop, Dankani has a motorcycle that he uses for "bodaboda," and this increases the income of the family. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000, which he hopes to use to buy more stock to put in his shop. His clients are people around town and passengers who get out of different taxis and buses.

He hopes that in future he will acquire more motorcycles and will be able to get more money and hence cater to the needs of the family. 

Dankani says his biggest challenges are the risky customers who take things on credit and never pay the money. He hopes to keep up the hard work spirit and achieve his set goals in life.

loans.use: To buy more items for his shop

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a very hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is married and lives with her husband and three children.

Chizi has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. In addition, she also runs a food stall and thanks to her efforts, both businesses are doing great.

At present, Chizi needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 30s, is married with five children. One is in school while the rest are grown up. For a year now, Fatuma has had two businesses: a motorcycle for transportation and a charcoal-selling business. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good return per month.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan that she has paid back successfully, Fatuma purchased more sacks of charcoal, which she resold. She used the business profit to pay for school fees and household expenses, for repaying back the loan and saving for her future. Fatuma will use this loan to open a new business selling clothes. She dreams to expand her businesses.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group “CHAMWINO", which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new business selling clothes.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 59 years old. She is married with four children aged between 20 and 31. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. She plans to use the profits from the business for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning. Aware of this, Nigora works as a teacher at a school, teaching youngsters of various ages. She is a teacher of law. Her main concern is educating these people, since they are the future of the nation and will improve standards of living. She likes her job very much. 

Nigora is 27 years old. She is widow and has no children. Nigora lives with her sisters and parents. She wants to repair her house, which is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing her house.

loans.name: Gulby

texts.en:
A hardworking woman by the name of Gulby lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband died some years ago, so she is a widow. She has two clever children. Her children are non-adults. Her children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but her salary is not enough for it. She works at the hospital of her region as a nurse and has a small salary. 

She must repair the roof of her house first, and then she must change the doors and windows. She is asking for a loan to repair her house. 

In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Hawa from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is single with one child, aged 5 years. In 2008, Hawa established her fish business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is that transporting the fish is very difficult sometimes because vehicles break on the way.  

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her child and relatives. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Rugiatu from Moriba town Bo. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 8 and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. She was a house wife, but she began this business because she wants to create income to educate her children.

Rugiatu runs a general store business. She sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Rugiatu says that sometime business is very difficult.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and pure water for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Selevelien

texts.en: Selevelien is 51 years old. He is a father of five children who all go to school. He has been a tailor, making clothes for the past 20 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fabric to make more clothes for sale. The profits from his business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to make more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun is 42 years old and married with five unmarried children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Baray district in Kampong Thom province. She has been in this business with the help of her husband and children for more than 20 years. Her farming chores are caring for and preparing the ground, planting, water balancing, weeding and harvesting. She normally generates a moderate income to feed her family.

As of now, she would like to acquire a loan of $1,300 through HKL to buy a used motorcycle to serve her family as they need to go to work or anywhere far away from their home. This will be a great support to better her living conditions. She promises to repay the loan on schedule and thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to serve her family as they need to go to work or anywhere far away from their home.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Baindu from Kandeh town. She is married with a 12-year-old child. Her child is currently going to school and Baindu also has two relatives at home. She began this business because she wants to be self-dependent.

Baindu runs a general store business. She sells soft drinks, cigarettes, batteries and biscuits. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week and for 10 hours per day. Baindu says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Baindu has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, batteries and biscuits for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living condition and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, batteries and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
ID Ghana, which supports this group of two women, was created on August 10, 2010. Comfort's Group lives in the same neighborhood. 

Comfort is 50 years old. She is a married mother of one boy. She sells fresh fish and capitalizes on her extensive experience, having done this for more than six years. She is standing on the right holding sample of fresh fish in the pan. 

She plans to use her loan amount of 1,500 GHS to buy fresh fish to sell to customers so that she can increase her earnings. She has competitors but has a good customer care strategy which makes her rise above all.

The earnings from her business allow Comfort to support her small family and to save with ID Ghana. Together with Regina, they will need a total amount of 2,100 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and sell to customers so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.name: Velena

texts.en: Velena is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She sells food items and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab, 46, is married and lives with his wife, grown son, daughter, daughter-in-law, grandchild and retired parents in the city of Batumi. Merab has chronic health problems and gets small-sized disability assistance from the local government. Merab’s wife works at a hotel as a confectioner and makes a monthly salary (nearly $240) that covers the required tuition fees for her daughter, who attends university.

As the existing funds are modest for such a large family, Merab decided to start up a grocery store in front of his house but found he didn’t have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Merab was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they require a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. But Merab has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with easy terms to rural, vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products.

With a loan of $1900 US, Merab will purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store. He will work as a salesperson himself and generate income. With his determination and this loan, he expects to improve his income and give his daughter a university education.

loans.use: to purchase stock to start a grocery store

loans.name: Belengine

texts.en: Belengine is 38 years old. She is married with two children. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 18-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town, BO in Sierra Leone. She is single with one two-year-old child.  In 2005, Fatmata established her wood business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works every day from morning until night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy wood and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Fatmata plans to take her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wood and palm oil

loans.name: Jullienne

texts.en: Jullienne is 48 years old. She is married with seven children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she plans to buy more sweaters, trousers and shirts to sell. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters, trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Up To Date Group

texts.en:
Lordvick, who is in his early thirties, is single with two children who are still going to school.  He has been running a beauty salon for two years now.  He works from 7.00 am until 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Lordvick's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock on the missing items in the salon stock.
