Helena is 33 years old. She stopped her education in the 5th grade, and has 4 children between 5 and 13. She started this business with little money from her fiancee. She sells palm oil and rice; spending 8 hours each day on her business from Monday to Saturday. 

A problem she faces is fewer goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mariama, a small-scale businesswoman based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Mariama has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to boost the quality and size of her business. 

Mariama  is a native of Kenema city. The 30-year-old has been a businesswoman for 14 years now. She is currently selling cloth, cosmetics, etc. This wife and mother of three primary-school-going pupils will use her loan to expand her business both in size and quality by buying a larger quality of cloth and cosmetics to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to  buy a larger quantity of cloth and cosmetics for her current stock

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Joy” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Margret. Margret is 39; she was born in Kono district. Currently, she is residing in Koidu together with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For 11 years now, Margaret has been selling clothes and shoes. With this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 16 años la cual asiste a una escuela cercana de la localidad. Ella posee una venta de ropa  interior y perfumes, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Ana es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para ella el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad por mayor. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ana tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en: Ana, who is 35 years old, lives with her life partner and her 16 year old daughter, who is attending a local school. Ana has a business selling underwear and perfume. The clothes that she sells is of very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices. It is for this reason that she has made a lot of customers recently. Ana is always very active and can be found working hard to get ahead in life. For her the purpose and courage that she invests in her work allows her to watch her business grow so that she can achieve a better future. This is why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to purchase a variety of wholesale clothing, so that she will be always able to meet the needs of her clients. Ana hopes that in this way she will be able to achieve financial security for her family and live a full life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wholesale clothing

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla es una mujer con 35 años de edad, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos. Se dedica a su actividad desde hace varios años. Ella vió la necesidad de generar ingresos sin descuidar a su familia, debido a que es jefa de hogar y tiene que satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar,y el estudio de sus hijos. Cuenta con una pequeña ayuda económica por parte del padre de sus hijos. Ella tiene un pequeño cuarto en donde tiene su horno industrial y realiza su trabajo. Cuenta con el apoyo de una tía para hacer sus productos y salir a venderlos. En su primer crédito le fue muy bien gracias al buen trato que le brinda a sus clientes y a la calidad de su repostería, pancito y empanadas caseras. Ahora solicita de nuevo financiamiento para comprar materia prima y moldes, para aumentar su cartera de clientes y asi crecer tanto a nivel personal como empresarial, y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is 35 years old, single and mother of four children. She has been doing her business for a number of years. She saw the need to generate revenue while still taking care of her family. She is the head of the household and has to fulfill the needs of the household and the education of her children. She gets a small amount of financial support from the father of her children. 

She has a small room where she has an industrial oven and does her work. She has the help of an aunt to make the products and to sell them. Her first loan was successful due to the good treatment she offers her clients and the quality of her pastries, breads and homemade empanadas.

Karla is requesting a new loan to buy raw materials and molds to increase her customer base and grow at both the personal and business level. She also wants to improve the living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for baking.

loans.name: Arlen Yolani

texts.es:
La señora Arlen tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de ropa usada la cual vende desde su casa de habitación. 
Doña Arlen es una mujer muy trabajadora y el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de faldas, blusas, vestidos, calzonetas, camisetas, sandalias, etc. para poder cubrir la demanda que tiene por parte de sus clientes.
Doña Arlen espera que esta inversión en su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo y sea reconocido por sus clientes.
Doña Arlen su sueño es tener su propia casa y poder seguir ayudando a su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Arlen, who is 30, lives with her husband in a district of Tegucigalpa, in central Honduras.  She has been selling used clothing from her home for 6 years.  Arlen is a very hardworking woman who needs the loan to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, sandals, etc. to meet the demand from her clients.  Arlen hopes that this investment in her business will enable her to make enough profits to support her family.  She also hopes that her business will continue to grow and be well thought of by her customers.  Arlen's dream is to own her own home and to continue supporting her family.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, sandals, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 31 years old and she has been living in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and it is the second-most populated county in Liberia. 

Rebecca stopped her education in the third grade. She has four children, between 6 and 16 years, who are in school and live at home. In 2001, with a little money from her mother, Rebecca was able to establish her business. She has been running a small local shop where she sells batteries. She spend nine hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is low income.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more batteries for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries for her business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
26-year-old Amie lives in Sanniquellie,the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the county with the second largest population in Liberia. 

Amie is a college graduate. She and her fiancé are living together with two children, aged three and ten, who are in school and live at home. She got a little money from her fiancé eight years ago to establish her table business, where she sells sardines, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc. She spends ten hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. She faces no major problems except low income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She appreciates the lenders of kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc., for her business.

loans.name: De Cristo La Gloria 1 Group

texts.en:
Andrea is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group De Cristo la GLoria 1, in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received six loans to invest in her business. 

Andrea is living in a rural town with one of her children. She lives together with her long-term partner. She started building her house with their family savings and, with the help of this loan, she will finish building her home with gates to protects her windows and doors. And the other member, Jhoanna, will build parts of her house, She first will build the bedrooms with this loan and she will buy concrete blocks, cements, rods, and other building materials to build the other part of the house, which will be of wood until she can finish building it. 

Esperanza International is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their homes while running their businesses and attending groups meetings. Both members request a housing loan for their home improvement. Andrea and Jhoanna thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Leayee

texts.en:
Leayee lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba county, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest county in Liberia by population.

Leayee is 48 years old. She did not go to school, is unmarried, and has a 20-year-old child who lives at home. With little money from her brother, she managed to establish this business six years ago. She learned this way of selling from her friends.

She spends 10 hours each day on her business from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 39 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. This area is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Fanta did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniquille. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have five children between the ages of 7 months and 16 years old. All of her children live at home; only three of them are in school. With a little money from her husband five years ago, she was able to establish her table business where she sells palm oil. She spends 10 hours per day on her business, Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is a low income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house. 

Thanks, supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for workers to harvest the coffee crop

loans.name: 06.3.1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food.

Hương is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hương is the group leader of the 06.3.1 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Mr. Jargal, 27 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering transportation service to local people since 2012 after quitting his blue collar job in a mining company. His wife has a position of book-keeper, and works in a fiberglass producing factory. Their son is a first grade student at an elementary school. 

His brother studies in Korea and didn't pay his tuition fees due to lack of finances. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay for his brother's tuition fees. As a sibling, he has responsibility of helping his brother, and he thinks investing in education is the best thing he can do for him because higher education will open more opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's tuition fees.

loans.name: Partrical

texts.en:
Patrical is 38 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. This area is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Patrical describes herself as a hardworking woman. She completed 12th grade before starting her business. She has two children, ages 4 and 11, who are in school and live at home. She got a little money from her mother to establish her business. She sells palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. and has run this business for two years now. She spends ten hours at her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is a low income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. This area is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Ruth stopped attending school after the 4th grade. She has three children between the ages of 6 and 20, who are presently attending school. She and her fiance are living together. She started her business by selling her mother's farm products. For three years now, she has been running a table where she sells rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, etc. She spends eight hours per day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, etc. for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: 12-05-06 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

Huê is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children..
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 12-05-06 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. 
Huê supports 2 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Huê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huê hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her children to do well in school, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 45 years old, lives with her mother in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling cosmetic products to local people by renting a stall at a trade center since 2006. Her mother has retired from work and gets state pension. Her son's family lives in an old house on a plot of land. She is afraid that their newly born child may get sick as the cold winter is coming closer. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, foam, vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors in order to renovate her son's house. As a result, her worry over her grandson will decrease and her son's family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy fiberglass, foam, vacuum insulated windows to renovate her son's house to keep his newly born child warm in the cold winter.

loans.name: 3.09.345.05.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits to resell.

Hương is 44 years old and married with 2 children. Hương is the group leader of the 3.09.345.05.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.
 
Hương lives with one dependent in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her other child is grown up.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to resell.

loans.name: 3.09.346.18.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sâm operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.  Sâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Sâm is 44 years old, and she is married, with two children.  She is the group leader of the 3.09.346.18.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2009, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sâm has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Boldmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Boldmaa, who is 30 years old, lives with her mother and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has divorced her husband, who now lives separately in another place. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension.

Boldmaa has run a grocery store since 2004, so she is quite experienced. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, so she is requesting a loan of MNT 7,000,000 to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, sand, shingles, vacuum-insulated windows, and foam for house renovation. 

As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house

loans.name: 04-03-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds to grow.

Xuân is 54 years old and married with 2 children.
Xuân is the group leader of the 04-03-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2007, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Pedro solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: semillas, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. así como muestra la fotografía para tener buenas cosechas y así el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Pedro lives in his own house with his partner and three children. Pedro has been making a living growing corn and beans for some years.  This has given him the necessary experience to look after his crops.  Pedro sells his harvest in basic grains market and, with his profits, he is able to cover household costs.  Pedro is applying for a loan in order to buy necessary supplies, (shown in the photograph) such as seeds, anti-plague treatments, fertilisers, herbicides, manure, and more.  With these products Pedro can earn higher profits and give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, anti-plague treatments, fertilisers, herbicides, manure, and more.

loans.name: Castora

texts.en:
Castora is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married, with five children. The oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 9. Her husband works as a farmer to support their family. 

Castora engages in farming. She grows tomatoes to help augment the income of their household. Her business started two years ago. 

Castora is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer to improve her harvest. 

In the future, Castora hopes to expand her farming business and to increase business profitability, to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Hena

texts.es: Hena de 78 años trabajaba en una oficina y cuando dejó de hacerlo y se separo de su esposo, todo se puso difícil; así fue como, para generar ingresos se apoyó en una amiga, quien le suministró algunos productos para que los vendiera. Hena comenzó su negocio, sobreponiéndose a todo, porque no era fácil vender cosméticos y otras mercancías, a las que no estaba acostumbrada, pero lo hizo visitando a sus compañeras de trabajo y con ellas gradualmente fue ganando su clientela, recogiendo el dinero de sus ventas a crédito y comprando en el centro de la ciudad, para responderle a sus pedidos. Desde hace 5 años se vinculó a empresas que venden productos mediante guías especializadas, pasando por 4 de ellas, con sus ingresos logró adecuar su miscelánea, comprando vitrinas y surtiéndola y últimamente vende mercancías de manera independiente de los catálogos y se sostiene comprando a precios de oportunidad, para ofrecer productos competitivos, que su clientela pueda comprar. Ella vende principalmente a créditos, que otorga a su clientela y el dinero es recuperado en un plazo promedio de dos meses, dependiendo de la cantidad de mercancías y el valor del financiamiento. Aunque vive arrendada con su hijo, tienen inventarios que exhibe en casa de su hermana, en un lugar cercano a su vivienda. Hena es una mujer muy trabajadora y adicionalmente tiene ingresos mensuales, producto de la ganancia o porcentaje que le deja la rifa regional de la ciudad, en la que la gente que le compra, aspira a ganarse una casa y un carro. Su clientela en este negocio son personas que usualmente le compran y que los considera como fijos. En la actualidad ha realizado un quinto financiamiento en  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con estos recursos, ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades, pues tiene nuevos clientes, y eso ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. Por eso agradece este apoyo y espera que la sigan ayudando. Hoy solicita un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía de buena calidad, traída desde la ciudad de Bucaramanga, en el departamento de Santander, pues allí trabajan con excelente calidad los productos de cuero como calzado y también la ropa, artículos que están encargados, a propósito de las navidades y el año nuevo que se acerca; porque en estas fiestas familiares, toda su clientela quiere estar elegante y animada para integrarse con mucho amor a su familia.
texts.en: Hena is 78 years old and used to work in an office.  When she stopped this work and when she separated from her husband, things became difficult.  In order to earn an income, Hena relied on a friend, who gave her products to sell.  Hena started her business, putting this work as her top priority.  It was not easy to sell cosmetics and other merchandise.  She was not used to this work but she did it, visiting work colleagues, and gradually, she developed a customer base, collecting the money from her sales on credit, and buying products in the city to fulfill her orders.  Hena has workied with four businesses that sell through catalogues for five years.  With the income she makes, Hena has been able to organise her store, buying display cases and stocking up.  Lately Hena has been selling independently from catalogues.  Hena buys products when prices are low, so that she can offer competitive prices to her customers.  Hena mainly sells on credit, collecting the money within two months (on average), depending on the amount the customer buys and how much it cost.  Although Hena lives in a rented property with her son, Hena has stock that she displays in her sister's house, which is nearby.  Hena is very hard-working and also has a monthly income - she earns a percentage from the city raffle, for which she sells tickets.  She also hops to win a house and a car.  Hena's customers usually buy from her, and so Hena considers them as her regulars.  This is Hena's fifth loan with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".  With this resource she has been able to increase her profits.  She has new customers and this helps her to improve her quality of life.  Because of this she is grateful for this support and hopes that the foundation can continue to help her.  Today Hena is applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy good quality marchandise that she will bring from the city of Bucaramanga, in the Santander department.  There the quality of leather products, such as footwear, is excellent, and so are the clothes.  Customers are order these clothes for Christmas and New Year, which are now approaching.  Hena's customers all want to look good for family parties and they are all excited to spend loving times with their family.

loans.use: to buy footwear and clothes.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia de 37 años de edad, tiene un pequeño negocio en el centro de Barranquilla, en el que comercializa ropa, accesorios para celulares y productos de ferretería, desde hace 7 años.  Claudia llegó a esa ciudad   hace muchos años,  como producto del desplazamiento de su ciudad natal y se ubicó en un barrio cerca al mercado de la ciudad; allí conoció a su actual esposo y también adquirió recursos del estado nacional de Colombia, inició su negocio comercial. Su empeño y dedicación, muy pronto permitió que avanzara cada vez mas; hoy tiene dos puestos comerciales en el mercado  de la ciudad, donde vende de contado y a crédito, con una frecuencia diaria, comprándole a proveedores, que le ofrecen buenos precios, para distribuir artículos a sus principales clientes, que son vendedores ambulantes  y compradores ocasionales, a quienes llama su atención con cada oferta. En la actualidad Claudia ha recibido 2 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado incrementar su negocio, pues teniendo un mayor inventario, genera importantes opciones de compra por parte de sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es la competencia en el sector, pero ella poco a poco recurre a su experiencia, para provechar el volumen de personas que le compran a  los competidores. En la actualidad está aplicando  aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa, accesorios femeninos, productos de ferretería y juguetes, pues se acercan las navidades, época que impulsa la venta de este tipo de mercancía y hacen de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Claudia is 37 years old and has a small business in the centre of Barranquilla.  There she has been selling clothes, phone accessories, and DIY products for seven years.  After being displaced from her town of birth, Claudia came to this city many years ago and settled in an area near the city market.  She met her husband there.  Caludia was given support by the Colombian government and started her own business, Claudia's determination and dedication quckly allowed her to progress. She now has two stalls in the city market, where she sells for cash and on credit every day.  She buys from distributors who offer her good prices.  Claudia sells to her main customers, street vendors, and to passers-by, who are attracted by the stalls.  Claudia has had two loans from the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".  With these she has been able to expand her business, and have a greater amount of stock, giving her the chance to offer more choice to her customers.  Claudia's biggest challenge is the competition but, little by little, Claudia's experience has helped her to win over customers from her competitors.  Claudia is applying for a Kiva, which she will use to buy clothes, women's accessories, DIY products, and toys.  Christmas is approaching and so she will be able to sell this kind of stock and make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy clothes, women's accessories, DIY products, and toys.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgontsetseg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cash collector specialist for a private firm since 2010. Her husband is a security officer at a private firm. Their daughter goes to high school. 

Mrs. Otgontsetseg is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy a low pressure heater, fiberglass and vacuum insulated windows. After installing the heater and windows and insulating their house with fiberglass, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to install a low pressure heater and vacuum insulated windows

loans.name: 04-01-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Chính is applying for a loan to purchase wheat flour, to make bread. She has a manufacturing business, making bread.

Chính is 53 years old and she is single, with two children. She is the group leader of the 04-01-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents.

This is Chính's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Chính has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Chính faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chính hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, to make bread.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag, 42 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old brick house on fenced land. She has been selling drapes to local people since 2012. Her husband leads a building team and performs interior decoration on order from clients. Her elder son is a member of the building team her husband founded. Her second son is a serviceman and her daughter studies at university.

 Mrs. Tungalag is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials she and her husband will repair and insulate their old brick house thus creating a more comfortable and warmer place for their family. Also they will burn less coal for heating and then release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is from Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is 47 years old and is married with 3 children who are school-aged. In 2011, Nieves applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Presently, Nieves is asking for a financial assistance of Php 50,000 to buy concrete, wood, sand and gravel for house renovation. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her house. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy concrete, wood, sand and gravel for house renovation

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a 22-year-old woman  from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 10 months old. Her husband works as a farmer, growing rice to support their family. She engages in farming. She grows and sells green onions, 'pechay' and tomatoes to help augment the income of their household. Her business started two years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more seeds like tomatoes, 'pechay' and green onions. 

In the future, Caren hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more seeds like tomatoes, 'pechay' and green onions

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 45 años,  estudio hasta septo grado, ya que por motivos de recursos económicos;  no pudo seguir sus estudios y decidió dedicarse a la agricultura.  Él es casado y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura junto con él.

Cuenta con  30 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, posee mucha experiencia, ya que aprendió este trabajo junto  a su padre desde pequeño;  también se dedicó a la agricultura, ya que a través de esto, pueden obtener la alimentación  para un año, y el resto que le sobra lo utiliza para sacarlo al mercado para venderlo,  de ahí obtienen algunos ingresos, el caminan 10 minutos para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo, y desarrolla su jornada de 6 de la mañana a 1 de la tarde.   

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  fertilizante para el cultivo de frijoles. Le podrá dar,  un buen  manejo y obtener buenos resultado de su cosecha. 

Él a futuro planea ampliar más el área de cultivo de frijol, ya  que con esto el obtiene más cosecha y podrá vender más producto, obteniendo mejores ingresos para su familia y tener un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is 45 years old. He attended school up to seventh grade; he was not able to continue his studies for economic reasons, and he decided to work in agriculture. He is married and has 3 children who work in agriculture along with him. 

He has dedicated himself to this work for 30 years, so he has a lot of experience. He learned this profession when he was young, working at the side of his father, who also worked in agriculture. Through this work, he can obtain enough food for a year, and he can use the rest that is left over to take to the market and sell, thus obtaining some income. He walks 10 minutes to reach the place where he works, and his work day is from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer for his bean crop. This will allow him to manage it well and obtain good results from his harvest. 

In the future, he plans to further expand the area dedicated to growing beans. In this way he will obtain a larger harvest, and he will be able to sell more of his production. This will give him a better income for his family and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his bean crop.

loans.name: 02-04-04-017_Hải Sơn, Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to catch fish. Hiền is 30 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 02-04-04-017_Hải Sơn, Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. Hiền supports one dependent. with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase a net to catch fish

loans.name: 02-04-02-022_Liên Minh, Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to catch fish. Liệu is 41 years old and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 02-04-02-022_Liên Minh, Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. Liệu supports 3 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Liệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liệu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liệu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liệu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to catch fish

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Altanzul, 25 years old, lives with her parents and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling jewelry to local people by renting a stall at a trade center since 2003. Her parents both work in the radio and television industry. She divorced her husband. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a variety of jewelry from a China border town at wholesale price. By doing so, she will continue to sell jewelry without worrying about inventory. Customer satisfaction will increase as well, due to the large variety of jewelry products. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive a la señora Ana, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad, la menor aun vive en su casa y estudia en la universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Ana además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa con la finalidad de ayudarle a su  hija en sus estudios y al ver que a su esposo no le alcanza para esto se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo y géneros, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer  tres o cuatro días a la semana, su hija por su parte también le ayuda vendiendo en su universidad o también a veces saliendo con ella, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva 16 años en este negocio el cual les ha ayudado a salir adelante cuando su marido no tenía ni para la comida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 16 años  y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es ver que su hija  termine sus estudios y sea una  profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Parque A La Madre" meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton.  This canton is known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the extensive plantations of uniquely flavored coffee there, and is also known for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

This is where Ana, 60, lives.  She is married and has 10 grown children.  Her youngest child still lives in her house and studies at the university.  Her husband is a farmer.

In addition to being a good wife and mother, Ana has a business selling all types and kinds of clothing and shoes so that she can help her daughter with her studies, as her husband's income is not sufficient to pay for this.  Ana sells door-to-door.  She goes out around the area 3 or 4 days a week.  Her daughter helps her with the business, selling at her university or at times going out to sell with her.  Ana sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil every time she needs more.   She's had this business for 16 years, and it has helped her to get ahead when her husband's earnings were not enough even to pay for food.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing and shoes.  Ana has been with her communal bank for 16 years, and she likes it because thanks to her first loan she was able to start her business.  Her dream is to see her daughter finish her education and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtuya, 46 years old, lives with her son in an old house on a plot of land in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an auditor at a private firm since 2010. Her son operates a bunker in a coal mine. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years so she is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks,cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Erdene-Ochir, 44 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife runs a small sewing workshop. Their elder son studies at university and their younger son goes to high school. 

Erdene-Ochir is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the on board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The electric car will be used for taxi service as his former car has been deteriorating badly over the years.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: 02-03-06-024_Đại Long, Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Thanh, a 61-year-old married mother of five, has been raising poultry and cattle for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces is a lack of business capital. She supports one dependent with her enterprise in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The leader of a four-member group, the 02-03-06-024_Đại Long, Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, Thanh is requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women in order to purchase more poultry and cattle to raise. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, to maintain her success, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Ndeury

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndeury, âgé de 50 ans, s’active dans l’embouche ovine depuis plus de 10 ans. Il habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Ndeury possède un cheptel de moutons seulement avec l’événement de la Tabaski, il aimerait renforcer son stock et pouvoir  satisfaire sa clientèle. Ndeury adore les bêtes et peut rester des heures à s’en occuper c’est sa principale occupation.
C’est sa première expérience dans le crédit et c’est à cause de l’événement qu’il le sollicite. Les bénéfices de l’activité serviront à nourrir sa famille et à régler leurs  besoins au quotidien.
Il a comme vœu d’avoir une ferme ou il pourra exercer aussi bien son élevage, que faire du maraîchage.
texts.en:
Monsieur Ndeury, 50 years old, has worked at fattening sheep for the past 10 years. He lives in a village located some kilometers from the main town.  Ndeury has a flock of sheep, but with the coming festival of Tabaski, he would like to grow his flock and be able to satisfy his clientele. Ndeury adores his animals and can spend hours taking care of them; that is his principal occupation. 

This is his first experience with a loan and it is because of the festival that he is asking for one. The profit from his activity will go to feed his family and cover their daily needs. His wish is to have a farm where he could raise his livestock and also do market gardening.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, a Tlaxcalan dairy farmer, does his best to make a living from his small dairy. Because milk alone doesn't fetch enough money to keep the farm running, Juan adds value to his product. In addition to selling milk, he produces artisanal cheese and yogurt. These products earn more money on the market and make it easier to keep the farm profitable, but the energy required to heat and transform the milk is both expensive and damaging to the environment. Juan finds himself spending several hundred pesos every month on liquefied petroleum (LP gas), the preferred fuel source in the area. 

Fortunately for Juan, he has plenty of manure on his site - hundreds of kilos are produced daily on his farm. With his 80 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Juan will be able to use his cows for more than milk; their waste will generate renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer. Juan will be able to generate enough biogas to virtually eliminate his LP gas use while concurrently receiving an additional resource - valuable biofertilizer to use on his forage crops. 

This investment will result in a virtuous cycle; the waste produced by Juan's cows will turn into energy used to heat the milk they produce into cheese and yogurt, as well as biofertilizer that will result in more food for them. Juan will both save money AND reduce his farm's impact on the environment. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena sells fruits, vegetables, snacks, and dried fish.  She engages herself in a rolling business using her cart. A loan amounting to PHP 5,000 will be used in purchasing fruits and vegetables in the market for her to sell in their villa

She enjoys doing her daily routine in her business.  Filomena has been two years in the business and has generated an income that sustains he daily expenditures. That’s why she is still operating the business from then until now. 

Filomena is blessed with three children, but all of them are working.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell from her cart.

loans.name: Amani Kwetu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bora est un leader du groupement d’affaire « Amani Kwetu», senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 44 ans  et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est divorcée. Elle  est vendeuse de souliers.  Elle installe  ses articles au point de vente d’exposition publique, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a plus de 4 ans.  La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de micro projets pour sa famille à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’accroitre son portefeuille en achetant 15 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, accroitre l’entreprise et construire une jolie maison. Les impayés et la vente en crédit sont des défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit dédiés aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables, pendant ce moment critique de guerre.
texts.en:
Bora is the leader of the Amani Kwetu group. She is an experienced entrepreneur, 44 years old, and a mother of two children who to go school. Bora is divorced. 

Bora sells shoes for a living. She sells her goods in a public sales area and sometimes from her home. She started this business with a loan from Hekima  more than four years ago. She has already completed many small projects for her family with the earnings from this work.

This new loan will help her increase her stock and buy 15 pairs of shoes. 

Overdue payments and sales on credit are challenges to the development of her business.

Bora would like to educate her children, expand her business, and build a nice house.

Finally, Bora strongly thanks Hekima for their dedicated support to small-scale entrepreneurs during this critical time of war.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 43 years old, lives with her three daughters, son-in-law and grandson in a big old house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a secretary at a private firm since 2004. Her eldest daughter runs grocery store while other two daughters both study at university. Her son-in-law works in the construction field. 

Mrs. Munkhtsetseg is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder at a copper factory since 1991. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. Their daughter studies at university. 

Banzragch is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 MNT, which he will use to pay for his daughter's tuition fees as well as dormitory costs. He believes that the best thing he can do for his daughter is to invest in her education, which will be helpful later in life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Adiyasuren

texts.en:
Mr.Adiyasuren is 57 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Handsuren and his two younger children help him to run his business of traditional Ger manufacturing. 

Adiyasuren has been running his business since 1993 and has good previous loan records since 2001. He has been expanding his business and employs both his children for decorating part of the Ger manufacturing and to teach them his wisdom and talent. He is now requesting 2,700,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of wooden planks to produce traditional Ger with fancy decorations for newly-weds in his town. He is little bit of a 'tough old bird' but is very responsible and a hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of wooden planks to produce traditional 'Ger' with fancy decoration for newly-weds in his town

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Khai is requesting a new loan to buy quality food and ingredients for her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality food and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Damdinsuren, 52 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been teaching conceptual art and artistic skills at a college since 2009. His wife has a position of accountant and works at a military base. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to connect his house to a central heating system. As a result, his family will no longer need to burn coal for heating, and thus release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to connect his house to a central heating system.

loans.name: Delgersaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Delgersaikhan, 36 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people for ten years. His wife operates a barbershop and hires two barbers. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovation of his house.

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en:
Mr.Bayarmunh is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife stays home, providing tailoring services while she takes care of their newborn baby girl and her family. His two sons attend local public school. 

In 2005, Bayarmunh was granted his certification as a Taekwondo trainer and he started his club to teach middle-schoolers. He has regular students, around 25 to 30 per month, to promote a healthy and active living ritual for children. 

Bayarmunh is now requesting loan of MNT 3,000,000 to purchase insulation material to insulate the house, to provide warm and comfortable living conditions to his family during the harsh, Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to insulate the house.

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
La Señora Beronica tiene 55 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa usada y venta de cameras, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Beronica es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y también desde su casa de habitación,  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de mangos,  melones, sandias, bananos, manzanas, etc. ya que desea instalar un puesto de frutas frente a su casa y de esta manera generarse otros ingresos que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
Doña Beronica espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña Beronica su sueño es continuar con sus negocio y se convierta en uno de los más reconocidos de la zona.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Beronica is 55 years old, and she lives in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras. She has been selling used clothes and bed comforters for three years, and has been doing business for 30 years. 

Beronica is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, and she makes her sales in the street as well as from her home. She needs the loan for the purchase of mangos, melons, watermelons, bananas, apples, etc. as she wishes to install a fruit stand in front of her home, and in this way generate another source of income that will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life a little bit. 

Beronica hopes that the investment she makes for her business will generate enough profits to be able to get ahead with her family, and at the same time hopes that her business will keep growing. Her dream is to continue with her business and convert it into one of the most recognized in the area. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: purchase mangoes, melons, watermelons, bananas, apples, etc. for her other business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 47-year-old woman from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 22, 20 and 13. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. She engages in farming. She grows and sells green onions to help augment the income of their household. Her business started more than ten years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer to gain more harvest.

In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsagdorj, 25 years old, lives alone in small brick house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts for two years. He is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as shingles, bricks, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, he will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Naranhuu is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband has helped her to run their family business of a grocery store in the first floor of their house since they moved to the city from Selenge province. They are self-employed and successfully running their business and make enough profit to cover their family expenses, their daughter's university tuition fee and the health fees of their younger daughter who is not able to go to university and stays home. Their youngest son is 5 and attends local kindergarten. 

Naranhuu is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000MNT to purchase large amounts of organic products from herders and other retailers to sell in her store and increase their profit to start savings for their son's future and education. They are a happy and hardworking family.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic products from herders and other retailers to sell in her store and increase their profit

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with seven children. The youngest child is 15 years old. Her husband worked in maintenance in a private company to support their family. She engages in vegetable farming. She grows and sells pechay to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 2 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional pechay seeds, fertilizers and a sprayer, to improve the harvest.  

In the future, Regina would like expand her farming business and increase business profitability to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional pechay seeds, fertilizers and a sprayer

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulam is 52. She lives with her 12-year-old son Buyan-Orgil in rental apartment in Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Buyan-Orgil attends local high school while his older three siblings are married and live apart.
 
Dulam has been raising her children all by herself for years and now her older three children are married and living by their own with no further help or support from their mother. Dulam has been working as saleswoman in a general store in local market for years and started her own business of cosmetics and other goods general store in local small market. She is trying to improve her living and raise her youngest son as good person with capability of living on his own in future. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter and increase her sales and improve her living.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter in order to increase her sales and improve her living

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Battseren is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Recently, she began working as a cashier at a supermarket. 

Battseren is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 MNT, which she will use to buy furniture such as closet, drawer, sofa, and television. With these items, her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Thy is a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district. She earns a living through farming rice and supplementing the family’s income by working as a tailor. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Thy’s group consists of two members who are both female. Thy is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district. Selling trash is the main source for her family’s income, and sometimes she also works for others for a fee. Engaged in these businesses for ten years, she is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the eighth loan for Thea’s group of two members, and they both completely paid back their past loans with VisionFund. Thea is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy trash to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy trash to resell.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en: Mrs. Altansuvd, 44 years old, works as physician at hospital in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. She owns a hotel in Ulaanbaatar for extra income. She is requesting a loan of 32,00,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As winter is coming closer, it is necessary to renovate her house. After renovation, she will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar is 47 years old, married, and has children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been working as an organizer at a diplomat corps for 10 years. His wife has position as a CEO at a high school. 

This summer, Erdenebayar raised vegetables and now wants to harvest them. Due to the lack of finance, he cannot afford to do. As winter is coming closer, his vegetables are in danger so he is requesting a loan for 7,000,000 MNT, which he will use to hire workers for harvesting and to rent truck for transporting. By doing so, he can supply his vegetables to local vendors so that people can eat fresh vegetables, which is useful for overall health.

loans.use: to harvest vegetables

loans.name: Turtogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Turtogtokh, 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been crafting sculptures since 2010. His wife runs a grocery store. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of MNT 7,500,000 to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into the air, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afi est âgée de 48ans. Elle n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Depuis 1997, elle vend des produits de détails (eau minérale, produits d’alimentation générale et cartes de recharges) Son activité se fait dans une boutique et par moment elle a des ruptures de stock. Pour pallier à ce problème, elle demande un troisiéme prêt à WAGES pour acheter en quantité considérable des marchandises. Elle veut devenir grossiste et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Afi is 48 years old. She has no dependent children. Since 1997, she has been selling retail products (mineral water, general foodstuffs and mobile phone recharge cards). She conducts her business out of a shop, and she occasionally faces stock shortages. To mitigate this problem, she is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES to buy a substantial quantity of merchandise. She wants to become a wholesaler and be more self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a bicycle transport service where he transports customers using his bicycle. He describes his biggest family challenge to be a lack of enough water storage. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water storage facility that will benefit three family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will sustain himself economically. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 10,000 KES and 20,000 KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. She is from the town of Garcia-Hernandez. Teresita is a farmer, growing and selling tomatoes to help augment the income of their household. She has been a farmer for more than 10 years. 

Teresita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers, and sprayer. In the future, she would like to expand her farming  business to be a successful entrepreneur and have a sustainable source of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and sprayer

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, aged 52, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has nine children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on five hectares of farmland to make a living. She has been in this business for 30 years. She is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day to support the family’s need.

This is the micro loan for Kim’s group of two members who are both female, and she is the first cycled client. Now requesting a loan, Kim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 42 years old and is married with three school-aged children.

Elisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elisa has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en: Gerlee is a master degree student in public university. She has chosen her major as a psychologist, and she is a very hardworking and passionate student. This loan will help her to pay her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Battomor

texts.en:
Mr. Battomor is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in their house in Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife provides tailoring and sewing knit clothes at home to sell to local customers. His three daughters attend local primary school and kindergarten. 

Battomor has learned to produce traditional winter boots with sheepskin which is the perfect for harsh, cold Mongolian winter. He has built a small Ger on his plot of land and started their family business of organic woolen products and winter boots and sell to a local retailer who sells their products in the local market. He is now requesting 6,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to start producing winter boots before winter to increase his sales and improve his living for his family. They are a happy, united, and hardworking family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start producing winter boots before winter to increase his sales and improve his living for his family

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from three years to 16 years. She describes herself as enthusiastic. She operates a clothing store where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest family challenge to be insufficient water storage. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water container that will benefit five people. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water container.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian de 51 años, es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar; en la actualidad es madre soltera ya que el esposo viajo a Estados Unidos, y luego no tuvo comunicación con ella.  Es así, que ella ha retomado la vos de mando y hacer de su hogar personas responsables, en la actualidad ya solo dos hijos dependen de ella.


Mirian se dedica a la agricultura y a administrar una pequeña tienda, por la mañana trabaja en la agricultura y por la tarde se dedica a la tienda ya que lo que vende son golosinas y licuados de frutas, la tienda tiene cuatro años de tenerla, por lo que trabaja 14  horas todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana hasta en la noche.


Mirian con el préstamo solicitado a fundación Campo, comprara más mercadería, ya que necesita comprar otros insumos como lo es jabón, aceites, champú, y granos básicos así como otros que la misma clientela le busca satisfaciendo su necesidad mejorar su tienda.
Los sueños de Mirian son mejorar la tienda ya que con los años que tiene, ella buscara otra manera de vida, porque en la agricultura el trabajo es más duro, su misión es consolidar su tienda para tener una fuente de ingresos de donde poder sobre vivir.
texts.en:
Fifty-one year old Mirian is a person that didn't have the opportunity to study; currently, she is a single mother since her husband traveled to the United States, and then lost communication with her. Thus, she has picked up the voice of authority and is making responsible people of those in her household. At present, only two children depend on her. 

Mirian works in agriculture, and she manages a small store. In the morning, she is farming, and in the afternoon, she works in the store selling candy and fruit shakes. She has had the store for 4 years, and because of it, works 14 hours every day from 5 in the morning to night.

With the requested loan from Fundación Campo, Mirian will buy more merchandise now that she needs to buy other products such as soap, cooking oils, shampoo, and staple grains among the others that her same customers are looking for, satisfying her need to improve her store. 

Mirian's dreams are to improve her store over the years, and that she will find another way of life because farming work is more difficult. Her mission is to consolidate her store to have a source income from which she'll be able to survive.

loans.use: buy soap, cooking oils, shampoo and staple grains among others that her same customers are looking for, satisfying her need to improve her store.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en: Mr. Battumur, 46 years old, lives with his wife and son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He and his wife have been collecting and selling factory wastes such as broken gears, bottles and copper products to Chinese retailers since their retirement. Before this, he and his wife worked as a driver and cook respectively. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy large amounts of waste products from firms. By doing so, his working capital will increase and he can generate more income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy waste products in large amounts.

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en: Mr. Naidan, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2010. Before his transportation business, he sold meat and meat products for living. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, taking care of the domestic work. He is requesting a loan of 4,700,000 MNT to buy winter tires for his truck. By doing so, he can transport goods safely on slippery roads during winter time.

loans.use: to buy winter tires for his truck.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is 31 years old and lives with her husband, twin boys and a daughter in their house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city Mongolia. Her husband, Damdindorj, is a driving school trainer. Her twin sons attend local primary school and her 2-year-old daughter goes to local kindergarten. 

Bayarsaihan has been providing tailoring services since 2008. She rents the basement floor of an apartment building in downtown. This is where she operates her business. She has built a regular customer base over the years. 

Bayarsaihan is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation and construction materials to renovate and insulate her house before the harsh, cold Mongolian winter comes. She wants to provide decent living conditions for her family. She is a hardworking, kind and thoughtful woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials to renovate and insulate her house before the harsh, cold Mongolian winter comes and provide decent living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and beauty products. She describes her family's challenge to be a lack of enough drinking water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility that will benefit her four family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia's greatest wish is having a healthy family and prosperous living conditions with her family. She is 51 years old and married. She has one child. She is engaged in a retailing business, selling rice, grains and various groceries. To get additional income, she is also selling a variety of vegetables and meats. Her income from the business goes for her family's daily household expenditures. 

Rosalia also wants to sell cooked meals and snacks as added offerings. She is thus requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more grocery items like canned goods, vegetables, meat and rice. She hopes to get greater income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like canned goods, vegetables, meat and rice.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a mother of one child already attending school. She is married. She plants and harvests calamansi, a small citrus fruit, on their farm. She learned this business from other calamansi farmers/growers in nearby villages. Marilou also started a business buying and selling calamansi for added income. She has realized that profits from selling calamansi are good enough to sustain their needs. She is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to her planted calamansi. She believes she will harvest more fruits by applying enough inputs to her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for calamansi

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Jagna, Bohol. Perlita raises and sells pigs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. To earn additional income, she raises vegetables.

Perlita is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy pig feeds, fertilizers, and sprayer.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers, and sprayer

loans.name: Saint Antoine De Padou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 1" est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honorine est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Toussaint. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges du ménage, Honorine prépare depuis sept ans, de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de poissons frits) dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement "SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 1", un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Saint Antoine de Padou 1 group is made up of 8 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that the group is requesting a loan through ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The representative of the group is Honorine, and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and married to a man named Toussaint. Together they have four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support.
